Based off the mystery box ingredient concept popular in shows such as Food Network’s Chopped and Iron Chef, players can discard and pick up new ingredients in their quest to make the best recipe out of their hand. Contestants then have to name and illustrate their dish on provided recipe cards and sell it to their panel of judges (their fellow contestants!). Creative Kitchen is a great way to gather recipes from friends and share a few laughs over “interesting” recipes. Cheers to Creative Kitchen’s next master chef!

Currently, the board game design includes 110 ingredient cards (expansion decks to come!), game board, kitchen timing device, pad of blank recipe cards and eye catching Creative Kitchen box.

112084.name: Dungeon Siege III: Treasures of the Sun
112084.description:
The DUNGEON SIEGE III: TREASURES OF THE SUN DLC pack is now available! Visit the retailers below to get your copy today.

In DUNGEON SIEGE III: TREASURES OF THE SUN, players will extend their journey and travel beyond the borders of Ehb to an all-new environment: the Aranoi Desert. On their search for a lost Legion hero, players will fight through hordes of new villains only to find a forgotten abbey hiding a long-lost secret: the greatest treasure of the Azunite faith.

Further supporting the hours of new content in the expansion, developer Obsidian Entertainment has introduced several refinements to the systems and mechanics of DUNGEON SIEGE III:

New abilities: Players will be able to attain mastery of the arcane through powerful new attack, defense and healing abilities
Level up to 35: DUNGEON SIEGE III: TREASURES OF THE SUN will further power up players by raising DUNGEON SIEGE III's existing level cap from 30 to 35
More monsters and items: Players will encounter new monsters in the Aranoi Desert—including mummies and giant skeletons—and will find more powerful items, adding to the thousands already available in DUNGEON SIEGE III
Reallocate Talent & Proficiency Points: Players can reallocate points spent in Proficiencies and Talents, enabling changes to character customization throughout the campaign.
New Enchanting System: Transmuting items now gives players chances at gaining powerful new Vials that allow them to enhance their weapons and armor through the DLC's new enchanting system.

Source: The Game Website.

112085.name: Focus
112085.description:
User Summary

You play as a small white blob. You must interact with each room to get through it. As you play you gain the ability to focus, along with standard movements right left and jump. When focusing, time slows down around you, and you can transport yourself instantly in the direction and velocity/range you choose, although your maximum velocity/range is always growing smaller as you focus. Try to escape!

112086.name: Family Vacation - California
112086.description:
The Simmons family are heading out to the sun-drenched shores of California and you have to help them get to their destination safe and happy. You’ll have to help them pack, get to the airport on time, board the plane, have a safe flight and get to their hotel at the other end. And that’s where the fun begins…

Hit the beach, take in a ball game, go to Playland Amusement Park – games, rides and the ultimate roller coasters and then help Barb compete on her favorite game show to win cash and prizes.

- 25+ Levels over 8 chapters
- 15+ challenging puzzles
- Bright, colorful graphics
- Fun for the whole family

Source: The Game Website.

112087.name: Focus
112087.description:
User Summary

Shoot the enemy triangles, and avoid enemy fire. The trick is that enemies and their bullets go in and out of focus. Only bullets in focus can hit you, and only enemies in focus can be hit.

112088.name: Serious Sam: The Random Encounter
112088.description:
User Summary

Serious Sam: The Random Encounter is an RPG for the PC.

112089.name: Four Second Fury
112089.description:
User Summary

Contains fifty microgrames each game you will be given four seconds to play. Make it through twenty microgames, you will have seven lives to do this with.

112091.name: NONSENSE
112091.description:
Altercation - The Card Slinging Action Game

Object of the game:
Players win the game by either Knocking Out all other players
OR
By being the player with a Vigor Point Total(VPT) Closest to the Target Number (TN) (in either direction) when all cards have been played from the deck and all players hands. *If two players are tied for Closest to TN, The Throwaway Pile gets shuffled and play continues*

How to Play:
1. Calculate Vigor Point Total (VPT): Roll the 4 dice add the total together: That is each players starting VPT. Write each players name and VPT on the score sheet.
2. Calculate Target Number (TN): Roll 3 dice and add the total. This is the number everyone is trying to get closest to by the end of the game.
3. Decide who plays first. Roll a dice, Flip a coin, etc.
4. Shuffle the Deck and Deal each Player 5 cards.
5. Place the deck face down in the middle of the table.
6. The first player takes their Turn and play continues to the next player on the left.

Turn:
Step 1: Draw cards until you have 5 in you hand (skip this step on the first turn)
Step 2: Do 1 of the following 2 options:
A. Play a card. Choose a player and play a Lose, Gain, (put this
card in the Throw Away pile next to the deck after addition or
subtraction takes place) or Defender Card (play this card in
front of you)
B. Throw Away 1 Card and Draw 1 new Card
Step 3: End of Turn

112092.description:
Haven Town is facing total annihilation at the hands (and teeth) of a horde of monsters from beyond the Shadowrift.

You, the heroes, must band together to drive them back. To do this, you will need powerful spells, skills, attacks and loot. When the game begins, you are a basic hero; you can explore and fight. Luckily for you, Shadowrift is a deck-building game! You can buy new cards to add to your deck, cards that will define you as an adventurer and complement the strengths of your fellow heroes. Unlike other deck-builders, there is constant interaction with your fellow players as you figure out who will gain which benefit from the limited supply of townsfolk, offer their coin to help construct walls, and seek healing from anyone who's learned such magic.

Shadowrift also features monsters that don't merely sit waiting to be slain; if you leave them alone, they will rip Haven Town asunder. They'll kill people, break walls, and kick your heroes in the face. Combat with them is intuitive (though frequently painful). For defeating a monster, heroes gain Heroism, a simple, consistent boost to their power that makes them better at anything they undertake. Since the monsters won't stop coming until the last Shadowrift is sealed or the town has been built into a mighty fortress, you'll need every boost you can take.

The second edition of Shadowrift features many improved mechanisms, including a revised system for how monsters choose who to attack (based on types of villagers, instead of specific people) and a new system for monster powers (making them much more dangerous). It also has a revised card layout and a great deal of new and improved artwork.
112092.name: Shadowrift
boardgameexpansion: Shadowrift: Eve of the Sickle Moon
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 36: Shadowrift and Breaching the Barrier to Miniatures Games
NJAGP - Episode 29 - Grown Men Who Play With Toys
Session Impressions: Shadowrift
Shadowrift
Vox Republica 096: Big Box, Big Problems

112093.name: National Park
112093.description:
In this game, you are managing a fictional National Park in the U.S. your goal is to build improvements into the park that attract more visitors. Unfortunately, more visitors bring more problems and nature is always trying to reclaim the land. Every round you will build you park and accrue visitor points, while one of your opponent's will take nature's revenge and another opponent will play the unruly visitors who will damage the park. At the end of every year, a visitor assessment is performed for each of the improvement categories and the number of visitor points you have accumulated in each category that will come to your park the following year are assigned. This is also the number of improvement points that you will receive that year to improve your park.

At the end of the last round, you tally up all of the visitor points you have accrued and receive bonuses for having the majority in each category. Highest score wins.

112094.name: GAME ON
112094.description:
GAME ON is the very first live card game.
The Game is played while watching a sports event.

There is a special deck made for each sport:

Baseball
Football
Hockey
Basketball
Soccer
Golf
Tennis




The two most popular ways of playing GAME ON….

Each player (2-5 players) are dealt 7 random cards. Leave the leftover cards in a pile, they will be used soon. Now.....

1. Let the sports event decide what cards to play by what is actually happening in the game. The goal is to dump all of your cards first. If the next play is running back running for 15+ yards and you have that card then you can play it. That is once less card you have to dump AND if that card you use is a + or - card then you get to dump more of your cards or have a player (or two) pick more cards up from the leftover pile. Its that simple.....AND FUN!!

2. Play your cards by predicting what will happen next in the game. The goal is to collect as many cards as possible. Before the next chance (inning, possession, break, etc...) each player chooses a play from the hand they are dealt. Place it face up so everyone knows whos playing what. When the first person who chose correctly wins then he/she gets to collect all the cards that were played. Plus if his/her card was a +/- card then she could get more cards from the leftover pile or they can choose the cards that other players have to dump. Trade cards are used as well and when you win with that card you get to pick a players card (blindly) to trade with your worst card. Its that simple....AND FUN!

***There are many other ways of playing GAME ON. Other luck games or harder games involving more skills and knowledge.***

Each sport has between 8-13 different plays in the deck. Some are rare but most are common plays.

112095.name: Blue Powder Grey Smoke
112095.description:
User Summary

A Civil War game covering portions of the battles of Chickamuaga, Sharpsburg & Gettysburg (very similar in play to Under Fire). By Ralph Bosson

112096.name: The Curse of Sutekh
112096.description:
User Summary
This is an adventure suited for any Dr. Who RPG.

Introduction
Daleks and Ice Warriors run amok in a warehouse. Outside, the world ended Millenia ago. And only our heroes can defeat Sutekh the destoyer one last time ...

112097.name: Children of the Daleks
112097.description:
User Summary
This is an adventure suited for any Dr. Who RPG.

Introduction
Called Children of the Daleks, it's a crossover between Dr. Who and Alien.

Landing for some reason (probably a malfunction of some sort) on the planet Ceres-18, a terra-formed agricultural research station, the Time Lord and companions find themselves in a valley containing extensive farmland. The only buildings are a cluster of houses, barns and labs some way away. They find nobody about on their way to the farm. When they get nearer, they see someone being chased by a Dalek, shouting "Do-Not-Move! You-Will-Be-Exterminated!" etc. A group of PCs should be able to overpower one Dalek if they surprise it (that happens quite often in the series). They learn that another Dalek is guarding all the other scientists and their families. After (hopefully) overcoming this one, they can be
informed of what has gone before. Two days earlier, a small spaceship crash-landed in the now-abandoned terraforming plant. The colonists were about to investigate when a Dalek ship landed. This surprised the colonists, as the Daleks have, at this point in their history, suffered major defeats and are in retreat. The Daleks captured the unarmed colonists, imprisoning all but eight of them. These were taken away on a hoverplatform to the terraforming plant, as slave-workers.

112098.name: The Boswell Incident
112098.description:
User Summary
This is an adventure suited for any Dr. Who or X-Files RPG.

Introduction
This TIME LORD adventure is a tribute to the TV show The
X-Files as well as a scenario involving UFO's. It was written for the Seventh Doctor and his current companions (whoever they may be) but can be run for any variety of Doctors.

The TARDIS materializes in the worst of all possible places (at least, insofar as maintaining freedom is concerned); on Boswell Air Force Base, right next to the infamous Hanger 19, the place where remains of aliens are rumored to be kept. After arrest, they are taken to an interrogation room.
There they meet FBI agents Malden and Scully, who are on base investigating the report of a crashed spacecraft.

112101.name: Oma, Tante, Anverwandte
112101.description:
Oma, Tante, Anverwandte ("Granny, Aunt, Relatives") challenges players to remember the faces of multiple oh-so-similar relatives and reproduce them.

In a round, each player receives a portrait card, looks at it secretly for some predetermined amount of time (say 15-30 seconds), lays the card down, then tries to reproduce the picture as accurately as possible. Players score points for each element that is the right shape, and more points if elements are the proper colors.

Some portraits have more elements to remember than others, so while your scoring potential is higher, you'll have a tougher time keeping everything in mind. After a certain number of rounds, the player with the most points wins.

112102.description:
Centipedes want to be as long as possible to stand out from their fellow 'pedes and in SchuhBidu players can help them grow and grow – but only if they have shoes to place on the centipede feet.

At the start of the game, each player takes a centipede "head" tile, while the feet tiles are placed in the center of the table. On a turn, the active player rolls all four dice, sets aside any he wishes, then rerolls up to two more times, with the option of rerolling dice set aside after the first throw. After his third roll (or earlier, if he wishes), he can take any one foot tile for which he has matching symbols on the dice (with suns counting as a wild symbol) and add it to his centipede

The game ends after all the feet tiles have been claimed, and the player with the longest centipede wins. The rules include a variant for older players in which you can steal shoes from an opponent.
112102.name: SchuhBidu
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

112104.name: Seepferdchen-Wettlauf
112104.description: If the wind likes you he plays a lovely bell tune into your ear. When you hear that, the sea horses hold a race round a sunken castle, dance in the fallen walls and the sea horse who is the first to be all around the castle, may ring the bell. A nice castle is put together and the bell is fastened to the bell tower. The players in turn roll the die, with a dark blue dot one may put a sea horse to the start and then in one’s turn again roll the die and move the horse. In case of a dot the sea horse moves to the next wall of that colour, for a ring to the next but one, and for an arrow it moves back one wall. If a sea horse is rolled, the player may move his horse through the next opening in the wall. Who reaches the bell tower first has won the game.

112105.name: The Unquiet Dead
112105.description:
From the Front Cover:

A supplement of undead NPCs for Vampire the Requiem.


User Summary:

This is an unofficial sourcebook written by a White Wolf freelancer that presents a set of seven vampire NPCs ready to be used in a game:

Jimmy 'Blakjack' O'Neil, the Street Enforcer (Ventrue)
Victor 'Memory' Klein, the Archiver (Mekhet - Mnemosyne)
Evelyn 'Ward' Edwards, the Watcher (Mekhet - Khaibit)
Sophia, the Keeper of the Swarm (Gangrel)
Shem Cannan, Seer of the Scorched Eye (Mekhet)
Bra'er Rabbit (Frank, Harvey), the Seven Foot Fuck-Bunny (Nosferatu)
Remi 'Le Beau', Conspiring Whoremaster (Nosferatu)

112106.description: The heart of the game are 55 double-sided cards, thus presenting 110 important phrases, words or questions, specially geared to holiday needs and packed separately in a plastic box for easy transport. A ring-track on the board shows empty spots and spots with city names. Players roll the die and move their token, if it lands on a city name the player can try to translate one card. If the translation is correct he/she receives one chip. The first player to collect 5 chips wins the game.
112106.name: Englisch für den Urlaub

112107.name: Dominant Species Express
112107.description:
Welcome to the Ice Age! Four primary species attempt to weather the randomness of nature as well as the cunning of the other species. You will populate a new land, expand to new vistas and possibly witness disasters. The object of the game is to dominate as many hospitable lands as possible.

The game is played on a dynamic hex board. You will need 15 markers for each color, five dice and pen and paper. Game mechanics are area of control with available actions determined by combinations of dice rolled. Play continues until one species has put all cubes into play.

112108.name: Quizfächer Pocketquiz für schlaue Kids
112108.description: A quiz in the form of a fan, on the subject of general knowledge - 'primary school level' -, 1000 questions and answers sequenced by time periods. The cards are held by a screw and can be ideally taken on travels, the answers are always on the next page. The quiz can be played alone or by several players.

112109.description:
Kolejka: Ogonek : Four small board game expansions

Ogonek adds to board game Kolejka a new queue emotions. Thanks to the sixth player set you are able to face the reality of the everyday life in Poland at the eighties in even greater group. Daily reports of communist party official newspaper "Trybuna Ludu" will result in surprising changes in the situation on the board. Purchased in the liquor store vodka as a "substitute currency" will revive exchange at the outdoor market and will allow you to gain speculators sympathy. If it seems to you still not enough - the “Range of Possibilities” cards will allow you to add your own "Trybuna Ludu" (Peoples' Herald) events and queuing cards.
112109.name: Kolejka: Ogonek

112110.name: Escape from Bahamut
112110.description:
From Introduction:

The heart of the Red Star Commonwealth’s economy is the black market. Once this nation was strong, making Imbohl’s vision a reality, but now it is fragmented and corrupt. Where once the military might of the U.R.R.S. was a thing to be feared, it is now laughable, filled with selfserving officers, poorly trained soldiers, and equipment that is at best unreliable. Criminal elements thrive, smuggling in goods and services at prices far lower than the highly taxed legitimate products. Thanks to the destabilizing influence of the underworld, many soldiers and offi cers have given way to the temptations of selling illegal goods, such as drugs, arms, and protocols, to various fences. On the Nokgorkan front, there are plenty of opportunities for an offi cer to find just the right thing to lift him out of poverty and enjoy the lifestyle to which he was once accustomed. In the case of this adventure, that substance is opium.

Escape from Bahamut is a short adventure for four 1st-level heroes. With slight modification, you can make it suitable for heroes at other levels or for groups as large or as small as you need.

112111.description:
Introduction

Xodd is an elegant connection and territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (from now on points) of a square board, which is initially empty. The suggested size is between 9x9 and 14x14. Both players must have access to a sufficient number of black and white stones. The goal of the game is to end up with the fewest groups on the board. Draws are not possible.


Definitions

A group is a set of orthogonally connected, like-colored stones. A single stone is also a group.


Rules

Starting with Black, players take turns placing one or two stones of any color on empty points. On his first turn, Black can only place one stone.

At the end of each turn, there must be an odd number of groups on the board (i.e. the sum of the number of Black and White groups must be an odd number).

Players can pass their turn at any moment, unless it violates the previous rule (this means Black can't pass on his first turn).

When both players pass in succession, the game ends. The player with the fewest groups on the board wins.


Notes on gameplay

Double placement serves both as a first move equalizer and a way to make the game playable under the group restriction rule.

Meanwhile, apart from the intended goal of eliminating draws (they would be common otherwise), forcing an odd number of groups at the end of a turn has many interesting tactical implications. For example, groups separated by two empty points can't be joined on a single turn, since the player runs out of stones to restore the groups count to an odd number. Also, the diagonal connection is safe if the opponent has exactly one or three groups adjacent to the two neighbour points shared by both stones, and unsafe otherwise.

Endgames are also quite tricky under this rule: you'll often want to join two of your own groups or create another opponent group, but you'll be unable to do it because you can't restore the groups count anymore!
112111.name: Xodd

112112.name: Winter Voices: Like a Crow on a Wire
112112.description:
For the first time in what seems an eternity, a tiny village crushed by the huge mass of mountains indicates the presence of other human beings... Will they be a great help or a danger more deadly than your desperate and icy loneliness? The road to the capital becomes clearer and the river, which crosses inhabited land, is not far behind the last peak and mountain pass. The acceptance of your fate and of potential relief of your inner turmoil seem attainable... As existence appears to be possible again, the fear of death grows more acute, increasing the risk of being sucked into a great void.

Source: The Developer Website.

112113.name: Winter Voices: Amethyst Rivers
112113.description:
The motionless voyage...

The interior and exterior worlds are made of hidden things - some are magnificent, others are frightening - all of them, in some way, are worth discovering. Is it your new life that is starting, or your proximity to the river? As you descend the mountain on the road to the capital, your vision clears little by little. For the first time, you are able to face your past, as well as your future. What do they have in store for you?

Source: The Developer Website.

112114.name: the Graveyard
videogamehonor: 2009 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
112114.description:
An old woman visits a city cemetery. She walks very slowly. The cemetery is filled with life. As she approaches the chapel in the center, the urban bustle fades away and she is left alone with her thoughts.

The Graveyard is a short snapshot of a life at its end, destined to make a big impression on the player.

http://www.tale-of-tales.com- Publisher Website

112115.name: I Want So Much More
112115.description:
From the Overview:

In this scene, the characters confront a friend that's been enchanted by a monster. Due to the magic, she believes she's in love with him. Evidence suggests that not only is he a monster, but he'll probably hurt or kill her if left alone long enough. The scene is a confrontation of the monster. Unfortunately, it's while the friend is present.

112116.name: B.U.T.T.O.N.
videogamehonor: 2011 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2011 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
112116.description:
B.U.T.T.O.N. is a physical party game for 2-8 players developed by the Copenhagen Game Collective, with music by Nifflas.

Race to your controller through physical space, and do whatever it takes to win (or to avoid losing). Act like a monkey, jump up and down, wrestle over the controllers, strip off some clothing, cheat your competitors, and above all, expect the unexpected. Brutally unfair tactics are, after all, totally OK now!

Source: The Game Website.

112117.name: Guerilla !
112117.description:
Guerilla ! is a miniature skirmish ruleset published in Vae Victis magazine issue #15. The game simulates battles of the mid-nineteenth century, especially the many colonial wars of the era.

The game uses a simple chit-pull system to alternate figure activation. An activated figure can move and/or fire, reload a weapon or attack in close combat. The rules include the different firearms available at the time (muzzle- and breach-loading rifles, pistols and carbines), cavalry, cover, morale, experience levels (a veteran figure will reload a weapon faster and have bonuses to morale, shooting and close combat), and a scenario simulating the last moments of the battle of Camerone.

Scale: 1 mini = 1 man, 1 cm = 1 m, a turn = a few seconds

112118.description:
RED is a three-colored tile-laying game for three players. The three colors in the game are black, white, and red, and each player will be a different color. Each tile has a background color and a different-colored circle in the middle. There are 6 different combinations and 5 small tiles and 1 large tile for each combination.

Players place tiles on the table trying to connect groups of their border color and groups of their circle color.

RULES

Place all the tiles face-up in a pool, leaving room to play the game.

Each player is assigned one of the three colors by some agreeable method and takes the corresponding counter; the counters just show which player is which color. The order of play is White player, then Black, then Red. Players take turns placing any tile from the pool on the playing surface according to the following rules:

- Tiles must be placed so that they align with an imaginary grid of squares the size of the small tiles.

- White cannot play a large tile on the first turn.

- Except for the obvious exception of the first tile, each new tile must be orthogonally adjacent to at least one small tile (i.e. must touch a small tile). Just having the corners touch isn't good enough.

- A large tile cannot be placed orthogonally adjacent to another large tile (that is, no two large tiles can touch each other, except at the corners).

The game ends when there are no available moves.

SCORING

Small tiles count as 1 point, and large tiles count as 2 points.

Find the largest connected group of tiles with your border color, and then find the largest connected group of tiles with your circle color. Multiply these two numbers to determine your score.

The player with the most points wins. If two players tie, the third player wins! If all three tie, play again!

The rules include a variant for 2 players.

Microbadges:
112118.name: RED

112119.description:
User Summary

2088 is a shooter. The player's character is a mercenary hired to help aliens evacuate a planet. Each level has two escape pods and a set number of aliens to evacuate. Aliens enter the screen and move towards the escape pods and the player (or players) must provide covering fire, destroy the many threats appearing on the screen and avoid being shot. Enemies include giant snake that split in two if shot in the body, flying saucers, laser fire from enemy bases, suicide bombers...

There is a bonus stage between each level, where the player must pilot a spaceship through an asteroid field and collect bonuses.

112120.name: Deutschland: Blutige Kriege & Goldene Jahre (2nd edition)
112120.description:
(from the back of the book)
Germany in the 20s is a place torn between two wars full of blood and a much too short golden period - the right time for investigators.

This reedition of Deutschland: Blutige Kriege & Goldene Jahre contains everything you need to play there, in 12 chapters:
the big politics, the ordinary life, economics, traffic, leisure, entertainment, lust and vice, science and technique, crime and the law, the occult, of dark cults and darker demons plus many playing aids to make adventures more realistic

Moreover, it contains 3 adventures ready to play: Tempus fugit (from the old edition) and two new ones:
Gefrorene Angst (frozen fear) and Bilderwahn (picture delusion)

...and a coloured map of Germany

112121.name: Les Visiteurs: Le Jeu
112121.description:
A familly game about a french movie (a big success).
An evil wizard has sent you in the twentieth century. To return to your epoque (1123 AD), you must find magical ingredients to reopen the corridors of time.
A fun game for a familly, an hard addiction for the movie's fans.
The goal : On a journey full of obstacles, traps, psychiatric hospitals, you must be the first to recover the three magic ingredients to return to your day. The first player to complete this conditions wins.
The manner : After a dice roll, you move your pawn on a case and you have a question about the film or you must make an imitation of the movie's actors (there are many ...) If you are correct, you can reroll another dice to get closer from a Magical Ingredient. The cases of the board need specific action, you lose your turn or change direction.
Components : 1 bonus roundel
6 pawns
1 8-sided die
138 cards, Movie, Surprises, Imitations and Magic Potion.

The winner must say "Per Horus, et per Ra, et per Solem, in victus, luceres" and normally he must go back in 1123 AD...

112124.name: Kreuzzüge: Ritter im Heiligen Land
112124.description:
(from the back of the book)
The social and military clash of christians and muslims from 1095 to 1291 takes its bloody toll in 7 crusades, countless smaller wars, civil wars and intrigues. The land from Constantinople to Egypt is the stage of countless invasions, fights and revolutions. Especially, of course, the Holy Land.
This book should lead th game master ind his players into a very dark mixture of real history and a cthuloid variant of teh arabian nights. As, like every so often, the crusades show that the biggest enemy of man is not man, but the evil from beyond the stars.
Detailled hints for keepers, new occupations and oprional rules for mass battles cerate the opportunity to fight on both sides of the war.
An introductionary adventure and a mini campagne confront the player characters with abhorrent events during the first crusade.

112126.name: Extreme Edge Volume Two, Issue Eight
112126.description:
From the back of the PDF


The Bleeding Edge!

Is it a magazine for showing Hot Chicks doing Extreme Sports? Or is it a secret communication to the warriors in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind?

Kale Fleigh, the enigmatic editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, isn't telling. But with any luck, the information in these pages will save the lives of some adventurers, or at least give them the chance to go down fighting!

In this issue...

Cover Girls Mist and Smoke Salari - twin fashion models and martial artists!
We Review the Gunderson AR-15 Pistol!
Fifi Fleigh-Blazes reviews the Ishitawa Ser-vomech 2!
Editorial: “Friggin’ Robots”




When you live on the Extreme Edge, you're always a razor blade's width away from catastrophe... and you need a magazine that understands you. Welcome to the Extreme Edge!

112127.name: Extreme Edge Volume Two, Issue Nine
112127.description:
From the back of the PDF


The Bleeding Edge!

Is it a magazine for showing Hot Chicks doing Extreme Sports? Or is it a secret communication to the warriors in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind?

Kale Fleigh, the enigmatic editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, isn't telling. But with any luck, the information in these pages will save the lives of some adventurers, or at least give them the chance to go down fighting!

In this issue...

Cover Girl Emily “Vixen” London: Alien Hunter!
We Review the Sanderson Thompson Infinity!
Sierra Devonshire reviews “Wonder Tabs!”
State of the World: Medicine
Editorial: “The Quick Fix”




When you live on the Extreme Edge, you're always a razor blade's width away from catastrophe... and you need a magazine that understands you. Welcome to the Extreme Edge!

(This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game. You will need the Core Rulebook to play.)

112128.name: ISS Pro Evolution
112128.description:
ISS Pro Evolution (known as Winning Eleven 4 in Japan) is the third video game in ISS Pro series developed exclusively for the PlayStation by Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo, a division of Konami.

The engine has been recreated providing new player movements, animations and improved graphics. During promotion following taglines have been used: "The King of football returns" and "This really IS football!". The new version featured updated player rosters, extended amount of game modes, teams (including club teams for the very first time), stadiums and settings providing highly developed player editor not as long limited only to name edition. The game was precise in every detail and aspect of the game, such as the fact that the team captain could be selected with the captain's badge on arm and the colour of players' shoes could also be individualized. The replays could be stored on the memory card as well as won trophies and unlocked bonuses. In this version the one-two-pass system has been highly developed, becoming one of the greatest threats to the opponent and dribbling including trick-shooting has been introduced as a new trick in gameplay.

Source: Wikipedia, "ISS Pro Evolution", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112129.name: Noggle Stones
112129.description:
From the PDF


NOGGLE STONES is a role-playing game of fantastic adventure set in a past that never was. When the forces of darkness grow too strong to be contained in the world of the Faerie Kingdom, the fiends then cast their shadow over the dawn of 20th
Century America. Can the goblins, elves, and dwarves put aside their differences to ally with the Great Republic of these United States? Can alchemy and sorcery stand up to locomotives and six-guns? How can a nation founded on liberty work together with a king and queen? What chance does any man or woman have against fear, when fear itself is a force all too real?

What is NOGGLE STONES?

The world of Noggle Stones takes place in the United States of the 1900's, but not the one we know from the history books. At the turn of the century, a miraculous magical event reunited the Earth and the long-lost land of Faerie in to a single world. Once again, humans live in the same world as the fae people: the regal Aes Dana, the insular Dwarves, the eccentric Goblins, and the reclusive Ogres. Now, just as the United States was beginning to recover from the struggle of the Civil War and connect the two coasts with the transcontinental railroad, the nation must cope with this strange new state of affairs. Your adventures take place in this exciting time, when the magic and technology of both worlds are coming together!

112130.name: Rocket Jockey
112130.description:
User Summary

A sports game that defies an exact classification. It combines soccer, racing, demolition derby, rocketry, and surf music into a unique action game. Your pilot straddles a rocket (or "sled") which propels you in a straight line ("an object in motion stays in motion..."). You then fire grappling hooks to attempt to latch onto objects in order to steer your rocket like the Batmobile in the Batman movie of '89. Said grappling hooks can also be used to latch onto a giant soccer ball, which can be thrown into various nets/goals to score points or better yet, thrown at your opponents to dismount them from their rockets. You can even yank enemy "jockeys" off their mechanical steeds with a well aimed grapple, and then drag them around the arena. The game uses a physics engine that makes every action have a reaction. You'll find yourself making hard left turns with a grappling hook, while a second hook is spinning the soccer ball around like a cat-o-nine tails. All the while the surf sounds of Dick Dale are blasting in the background. The game captures a retro vibe of a 1920s that never existed.

The game features 3 modes:
Rocket Ball- soccer astride an out of control rocket
Rocket Race- may the fastest man win
Rocket War- deathmatch: smash, crash, and grapple your opponents for the win

There's multiple rockets and pilots to choose from, different arenas, and upgrades to earn.

So what are you waiting for? Strap on a rocket, turn on the Dick Dale and blast off!

112131.name: Streak Hoverboard Racing
112131.description:
Rear of Case

Reject the tyranny of gravity and embrace the future of board sports. GEM Blading - extreme hoverboard racing reserved for the reckless and the lawless. Experience an explosively fast, stunt-packed race in the pursuit of pure adrenaline. 12 unique Streakers want you for the aerial underground!

Completely unique GEMBlad hoverboard racing. Incredible control and maneuverability - an all-new racing experience!
10 maverick Streakers to choose from. 12 interactive race environments ensuring each race is a radically new experience. Revolutionary anti-gravitational physics based on skateboarding, snowboarding, and surfing. Compete in the worldwide Streaker circuit and ra e your way to the #1 ranking. Shadow mode allows you to compete against your own best time. Take on up to four challengers with split-screen gameplan and the like .

112132.name: This is Football
112132.description:
Rear of Case

This is true emotion. This is raw energy. This is reality. This is football. Over 230 teams, featuring over 5000 real players with individual playing styles. Over 20 authentic tournaments. Endorsed by FIFPro, the International Association of Football Players Unions. Revolutionary replay system offering fluid animation and unrivalled detail. Create custom tournaments and leagues and edit individual player attributes.

112133.name: Jump Ahead Year 2
112133.description:
JumpStart 2nd Grade (known as Jump Ahead Year 2 in the United Kingdom) is a personal computer game released in 1996 by Knowledge Adventure. As its name suggests, it was made to teach second grade students. It was replaced by JumpStart Advanced 2nd Grade in 2002.

Like the previous JumpStart products, the game takes place in a school setting, but begins after school hours when a giant anthropomorphic frog named C.J. enters the classroom and frees a firefly named Edison. C.J. and Edison form a double act of sorts with C.J. being an ardent, self-styled "adventurer" while Edison is the more pragmatic straight man, who frequently makes sardonic comments in response to C.J.'s grandiosity. The duo have appeared in many other JumpStart products, such as JumpStart Advanced 2nd Grade; however, their looks and personalities have both undergone enormous changes throughout the years.

C.J. and Edison lead the user into a secret elevator hidden behind a bookcase. This elevator leads to several different floors, most of which are caverns beneath the school. The clubhouse and the classroom levels are the only ones to contain more than one activity. The floors are as follows:

Source: Wikipedia, "JumpStart 2nd Grade", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112134.name: 4-Way Countdown!
112134.description:
Players compete to achieve all numbers from 1 through 10 using 2 dice and simple math. Score is marked with wooden pegs that are flipped when a number is achieved.

Basically a four player version of Shut the Box. But it includes some variation. Players may not use the two dice as separate numbers to flip two pegs. Instead they use the two numbers with a basic math operand to create a single number to choose a peg.

Example: Dice roll 2 and 6 yields
2 + 6 = 8 6 – 2 = 4 6 ÷ 2 = 3
There are only 10 pegs so 6 x 2 = 12 is out.

From the box:
The ultimate challenge of your math skills by simply using numbers on the dice.

Re-implements:

Countdown!

112135.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 2 No 1 - Spring 2038)
112135.description:
User Summary

This is the first issue after the transition from Starburst to Nightmessenger.

In this issue: Opening Fire, The World "Out There," NOVA Game News, Local Hero, & Parting Shots.

112136.name: Cadaver City
112136.description:
An Offal Game for 1 or 2 players

Pity the poor people of Cadaver City. Long ago they filled up all their cemeteries with their loved (and not so loved) ones. Now they’ve run out of room so they have taken to dumping the bodies down the sewer (out of sight out of mind). You, enterprising 3rd Class Sewer Engineers (Plungers), see a chance to make some fast money and solve the corpse clog threatening to overwhelm the existing system. At a quiet back door behind the Treatment Plant a line of customers queue up for the bits and pieces you have on offer. Deliver them the right parts, aged to the right amount of time and you’ll receive your reward.

Needed to play: The deck of 27 cards
10 eurocubes in each of 4 colors for the body parts (white for Bones, brown for Organs, gray for Brains and red for Hearts) and 9 black eurocubes for the rats
1 eurocube marker in each of 2 other colors to keep track of player scores on the Gore Track
1 large bag [or an old sock] (the Bag O’ Parts) to hold all the body parts, 10 small ziplock bags to act as body bags in the game and 1 four-sided die

Setup: Place the 4 Sewer Pipe cards, Gore Track, and the score markers between the Plungers (players).
Shuffle the customer deck and deal 2 customers to each Plunger, placing the rest in a face down draw pile known as “The Queue”, next to the Sewer Pipe. Each plunger should place their customers face up in front of them.
Shuffle the tool deck and deal 3 tools to each Plunger that they will use as their initial hand of cards. The remaining tool cards will be placed in a tool card draw deck next to The Queue.
Place the body bags within reach of both Plungers. Each Plunger should take 1 body bag for each customer they have during the game. Lastly place all the body parts and rats in the Bag O’ Parts.

Phase 1: Adding new body parts
Roll 1d4 and add that value to the number of waiting customers in front of them. The Plunger will then blind draw that number of body parts from the Bag O’ Parts. Shift all existing body parts towards The Clog to make room for the incoming body parts. Rats will never move. Set aside any body parts that are shifted off of the Day 3 card into a reserve pile. Place the new body parts in the order they are drawn on the Sewer Pipe cards beginning from the rightmost space on the Day 1 card. If any rats are drawn they will be placed on the Rat spaces beginning from the far left of the Day 3 card. Any body part occupying a Rat space where a Rat will be placed, during this phase, will be removed and tossed back into the Bag O’ Parts.

Roll 1d4 and place that many reserved Day 3 parts on The Clog card spaces, tossing the rest back in the Bag O’ Parts.

Phase 2: Filling orders
Each customer card lists the number of parts required to fill the order.

To fill an order a Plunger must choose all of any of 1 type of body parts on any one Sewer card (meeting the desired aging requirement) placing those parts in the customer’s body bag. Any extra body parts not needed for the orders go back in the Bag O’ Parts. Plungers may use the body parts to attempt to fill 1, 2 or more customer orders as long as the body parts are of the desired type and aging. If a customer’s complete order is filled the Plunger scores the money value, indicated in the lower right corner of the customer card, on the Gore Track. All body parts from this order are then tossed back in the Bag O’ Parts. A new customer is then drawn from The Queue.

Tool Cards: Each Plunger may use one of their tool cards at any point during their turn. Once played, the card will be placed on a discard pile next to the tool card draw pile and a new card is drawn.

Game End: The game ends in one of two ways:
a. The Clog card has become full of body parts. In this case, the current Plunger finishes their turn and any final scoring is marked.
b. All 10 customers have had their orders filled.

The Plunger who has earned the most money is declared the winner and receives a promotion to 2nd Class Sewer Engineer.

This game can be played solo as well. See the rules for modifications to the game.

112137.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 2 No 2 - Summer 2038)
112137.description:
User Summary

This issue represents a significant increase in the number of articles...

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Milestones, In the Arena, On the Road, The Showroom, Local Hero, Closing Shots, & Editorial.

boardgamehonor: 2014 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
2014 Origins Awards Best Board Game Nominee
2014 Spiel der Spiele Griffin Scroll Winner
112138.description:
In Hormonde, a strange world deep in the folds of time, the Hour Demons have finally found a hobby worthy of their cruel hearts... the Arena! The idea is simple. They select warriors of all ages and lands and whisk them away to the Hormonde where the enslaved gladiators must fight for their souls and the chance to become the ultimate champion. Why don't the gods put an end to this macabre circus? Why does Xelor himself turn a blind eye to the demons' meddling with time's delicate web? Well, you may ask, but it is not for us mortals to know the minds of the gods.

Krosmaster: Arena is a player-vs-player, tactical card game with anime-style miniatures that offers the craftiest tacticians among you the chance to challenge other players to heated battles in arenas scattered around Hormonde. All players build their team using a pre-determined method, whether a point system, draft, or at random. Equip your team with spells, weapons and other items adapted to their requirements, then utilize their various talents and abilities to create a powerful fighting force. Every figure has a point value attached to it to help balance things out. Randomly drawn event cards spice up the game at each turn, and the winning conditions differ for each game based on the scenario you choose to play. Only those who are able to create a strong, yet versatile, strategy will prevail!
112138.name: Krosmaster: Arena
boardgameexpansion: Krosmaster: Arena – Argon Gass Exclusive Figure
Krosmaster: Arena – Count Frigost exclusive figure
Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #1 – Fire and Ice
Krosmaster: Arena – Exp #4 – Earth and Wind
Krosmaster: Arena – Goultard the Barbarian Exclusive Figure
Krosmaster: Arena – Season 1 Alternate Terrain and Demonic Rewards Tiles
Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #1 – Riktus Assault
Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #2 – A Lucky Guy
Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #3 – Head Hunters
Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #4 – Armored Brotherhood
Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #5 – Dura Lex Duc Rex
Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #6 – Dragoon Power
Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #8 – Holy Missile
Krosmaster: Arena – Yugo Young King Promo

112139.name: Gotham G-200 Ice Hockey Game
112139.description:
This appears to be the first hockey game made by Gotham.
Game says that patent applied for GOTHAM'S G-200 TOY, ICE HOCKEY GAME
Manufactured by GOTHAM PRESSED STEEL CORP from NY USA.
MADE IN UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
Game measures 24" long x 11" wide.

This is the same game as GOTHAM G-800 Ice Hockey game already in the DB. This game of course is different because it is not electric. You have to hand hold the goalies who resemble the look of the Electric G-800 goalies.

112140.description:
Introduction
Welcome to the first issue of Diary of the Doctor Who Role‐Playing Games (DDWRPG) the fanzine devoted to Doctor Who role-playing games and related gaming information. We hope to bring to you information about the various Doctor Who RPGs, reviews of products (current and retro), adventure modules for you to use in your own campaigns, give you Game Master and player tips and information, as well as simply be a good resource for Doctor Who related gaming in general. There will be times that we also cover other games and RPGs but our focus is the world of Doctor Who.

112141.description:
Introduction
Welcome to our second issue! This is really an issue that is all about giving thanks. No not in that religious way where we all take a moment of silence... but maybe...

112142.description:
Introduction
Welcome to the companions issue! This one is dedicated to the supporting characters on Doctor Who and the non‐Time Lords of RPG campaigns. You’ll find lots of good articles and ideas that you can apply to characters in your Doctor Who RPG games. There’s also some great articles on girl gamers and their perspectives too!

112143.name: Game of Golf
112143.description: This game from McLoughlin Brothers was a game that featured a mechanical man who was controlled by the player. The scorecard that came with the game showed how long each hole was and a conversion into inches was then made by the players. There was an out-of bounds marker and a sand trap and movable green to navigate to and then with a deft touch the ball could be putted into the hole.

112145.name: Four Second Frenzy
112145.description:
User Summary

A series of fifty minigames, designed by 26 different developers. You will have four seconds to grasp the game, play, and defeat it. If you do not you will lose a life. In Normal mode you will play twenty minigames at random, and have seven lives to get through them. In Endurance mode you will play all fifty games, and have ten lives. In Sudden Death mode you will have one life to play all fifty games.

112146.name: Hanger
112146.description:
User Summary

You are an active and adventurous fellow, who enjoys daredevil activities! Swing from one end of the level to the finish, while holding onto as much of your body as possible. Any time you smash into an object, you will lose part of your body, and points.

112147.name: Hanger 2
112147.description:
User Summary

Hanger 2 features new levels, improved graphics and sound, and additional gameplay elements from Hanger. The essentials of the game are unchanged, you will swing from your ropes from one end of the level to the next. The fewer ropes you use, and more body parts you hold onto the higher your score will be (hit an object, and lose part of your body). This game also features stars that can be grabbed for points.

112148.name: Heir
112148.description:
User Summary

A mysterious action platformer. You must navigate a bizarre world, seemingly populated by a large statue. Make your way along the statue, begin over at checkpoints when you die. You have no weapons, only the ability to jump and pan the camera out. Inspired by Shadow of the Colossus.

112149.name: Mukden 1905
112149.description:
This game covers the battle of Mukden in 1905 during the Russo-Japanese war.

Though the title doesn' contain the word and the game is not designed by Mr. Nakamura, this is the latest addition of "Storm over" series game.

This game uses an area map and uses a card-driven system. The additional twist is Russian initiative. The initiative is decreased by losing territory, and can be recovered by sacrificing the card play. Also, this initiative is used for combat modifier.

The rules are easy and the game can be played within 2 hours.

Contents: 126 counters, 32 cards, 1 game map, 4 pages rulebook

112150.name: Helios and The Spartan
112150.description:
User Summary

Combining an Arkanoid style game with a hack and slash. Your primary goal is to keep a ball from bouncing on the ground, and get it to knock bricks out above you. Mixing it up are enemies who can slow you down, thus causing you to miss getting to the ball in time. Every time the ball bounces on the floor, it will cause you to lose hit points. If you succeed in bouncing it against your shield, you will gain them.

112151.name: Iron & Steam
112151.description:
Iron & Steam is a rules system for playing out ironclad naval combat in the era of the American Civil War. Game play is relatively streamlined, while rules include a good amount of specific technical information to satisfy those wanting a greater degree of granularity and detail. As such, the rules contain pre-generated game statistics for historical vessels, but also provide guidelines for converting any vessel to in-game play statistics. Similarly, for simplicity identical gun ranges are suggested for any gun of a given type (e.g. smoothbore cannon), while for those players wishing to add more detail and realism an appendix is included with expanded gun statistics to differentiate historical guns of various manufacture.

The rules are designed to use a scale of 1:2400

Also included is a bibliography of suggested reading.

112152.name: Tempus Denuo
112152.description:
Introduction
In a game of Tempus Denuo, you become one of these gifted individuals, a person with the ability to manipulate the fabric of existence, impressing your own will upon the mighty space-time continuum. What you do with your power is entirely up to you, but remember - Time will heal all wounds.

112153.name: Battle of the Sea of Japan
112153.description:
Covering the battle of the Sea of Japan (Nihon-kai is Sea of Japan in Japanese) during Russo-Japanese war 1905.

The rules are easy and very accessible and game can be played within 2 hours. Each turn represents 10 minutes and each hex 100m.

Each game turn consists of:

initiative determination
plot of the speed
first movement
second movement
damage control
fire combat
command control check




The game has 2 scenarios

Sink the Donskoi
Battle of Tsushima

112154.name: Tékumel Player's Guide
112154.description:
User Summary
This is a free player's guide created for playing in the Empire of the Petal Throne world.

112157.name: VR Troopers
112157.description:
User Summary

VR Troopers is a 2D fighting game where the player takes control of the three VR Troopers and attempts to stop Tankotron and his evil robots. The storyline of the game mostly follows the events portrayed in the short-lived TV show.

112159.name: The Time Lord Companion
112159.description:
Introduction
This is the second edition of this booklet and was designed as a set of rules to allow published adventures from FASA Corporation's Doctor Who Role Playing Game to be used in the Time Lord environment. To do this, the GM controlled characters and pre-generated Player Characters (PC's for short) need to be converted over to the Time Lord game system. This booklet provides the rules, tables, and guidelines to do this. Included in the Appendices are statistics for the Eighth doctor, presented in May 1996 in a made-for-TV movie shown simultaneously in the United States and the United Kingdom.

Things new to the second edition of this booklet are a revised set of rules written by the co-creator of the game, Ian Marsh on creating Companions. Also included is Allen Shock's set of rules for creating characters. As this set of rules seem to be more elegant than mine, I have decided to use it instead, but not without some adaptations on my part.

112163.description:
Introduction
Welcome to the modules issue! Many Game Masters are always looking for new or exciting adventures to run for their Doctor Who RPG campaigns. This issue is dedicated to the art of how to create your own modules, as well as giving GMs a number of modules to use in their own campaigns. How many modules? How about at least one for each Doctor!

Welcome to our new look issue!
Well, we have not changed that much in our fanzine but we did update a few items to improve our presentation. We have a new main logo to match the current series logo, as well as a new die logo that will appear at the end of our articles, to let readers know that the article they are reading is wrapping up. Thanks to the efforts of one of our ardent supporters for creating these for us!

Introduction
Welcome to the Time and Travel issue! This month we look at a few resources dealing with time when gaming and travel in real life. It's a mix of both time and space.

112166.description:
Introduction
Welcome to the Music issue! This month our Doctor Who role‐playing fanzine has worked to try to give you a rather special interactive issue. The sort of thing we are sure Delia Derbyshire would have been excited to see back in 1963. Included in this issue, besides an article on using music to enhance RPGs and a listing of some great albums that one can use, is an adventure module that has music embedded directly in this PDF! Yes, thanks to the modern technology of the computer we are able to include the music for the adventure right in this file. So, if you are reading this PDF on‐line or
downloaded, you should also have our free music!

112167.description:
Introduction
Last month we promised an article on Gaming Apps for Doctor Who role‐playing for the iPhone and other mobile devices. But as life sometimes is not as planned out as even our high tech gadgets often want, we have to move that article back to another issue. No worries, you’ll see it soon enough.
In this issue there are a number of neat features. As we have reports from Mackinac Island, from a visit to the J.R.R. Tolkien exhibit, our gaming trip to SnowCon 2011, plus other Who related events of note, we decided to call this our Events Issue because of the places we visited and the items we covered. Why do we cover some non‐gaming events in our fanzine? Because knowing what Doctor Who gamers are doing besides gaming is important to other for knowing where to meet or find other gamers as well. Think of it as a Whovian social primer. Never fear gamers, the issue still has Game Master advice, modules, etc. that many of you wait for.

112168.description:
Introduction
Welcome to this month’s issue of DDWRPG. This is our Historical Issue focusing on playing games that have an element of real history in them - whether a full historical or a pseudo historical that also has some sci‐fi elements in it.

112169.description:
Introduction
Welcome to the UNIT issue! Fortunately for us, the United Nations has had the ware withal to create an organization called UNIT (the Unified Intelligence Taskforce - originally called the United Nations Intelligence Taskforce) to help us investigate the strange and unexplained and to protect the Earth from extraterrestrial threats. Well, if it really worked the way it was supposed to, that’s what the UN would do...

112170.name: Diary of the Doctor Who Role-Playing Games (Issue 11 - Aug 2011)
rpgissue: Diary of the Doctor Who Role-Playing Games
rpgissuearticle: Cubicle 7 Doctor Who Product Line News
112170.description:
Introduction
Hello and welcome back to another issue of DDWPRG. This is our GenCon issue, covering the events of the grand gaming convention held annually in the United States.

112171.name: Diary of the Doctor Who Role-Playing Games (Issue 12 - Sep 2011)
rpgissue: Diary of the Doctor Who Role-Playing Games
112171.description:
Introduction
Welcome to our latest issue which is a bit of a "Gazeteer". What’s a "Gazeteer" you might ask? It's a guide of locations, much like a Fodor’s or Rick Steves' travel guide. In RPG terms, its an assembly of locations suitable for use in modules that a Game Master can utilize in their Doctor Who RPG campaign. Special thanks to misterharry on the DWAiTS Proboard forum for suggesting that we do a gazetteer issue.

112172.name: Das Kasperlspiel
112172.description: Harlequin cannot sit still, he jumps up and down, all limbs in different directions. Children try to immitate him with their harlequins. Each player receives a harlequin card and starts with arms and legs of the harlequin in a randomly chosen position. The cards are shuffled and seperated into three piles with 12 cards each. One player after the other moves an arm or leg of his harlequin exactly on step away from the previous position. If the new positions corresponds with the position of the harlequin on one of the three top cards in the stack, the player takes this card. When all cards are gone, the player with the most cards wins.

112176.name: Das Niederösterreich-Spiel Land-und-Leute-Edition
112176.description:
Quiz game on the 573 communities of Lower Austria, the active player rolls a die for the number of the question to read out, all other players answer as a team with a number. The active player then guesses if the actual answer will be higher or lower than the answer given by the others. Depending on the result the active player receives a chip. At the end of the game the player with the most chips wins.

Expansion for the Member’s gift 2004 of the Volkspartei Niederösterreich

300 new questions on 55 new cards for 'Das Niederösterreich-Spiel'
also contains a small rulebooklet, and can be played without the base game as well (however, then a die and 21 coins or something similar are needed)

112177.name: Das Original Blanko Junior
112177.description:
Aim of the game at this Junior version of the original word game is to collect most of the color pyramids.
Letter tile-laying game similar to Scrabble but with some additional features. Letters may be changed in words already laid and placing a word over a single "Blanko" square allows for bonus scoring by placing letter tiles on a card within one minute time limit. Covering two or three "Blanko" squares doubles or triples word score respectively. The plastic board-surround doubles as tile racks and scoreboard.

112178.description:
It's been three years since the nation's unification. Rumours have begun to spread of a rare and precious gem, discovered in the Mererani Hills of Northern Tanzania.

In Tanzania, players seek to increase their fortune, skill and renown to attain the most valuable gemstones. However, collecting gemstones is no easy task! Players will need to use their limited resource and clever planning to surpass the competition.

The game ends once two of the four markets (columns) have closed, after which the player with the most points is declared the winner.
112178.name: Tanzania

112181.name: Face the Music
112181.description:
English trivia game based on a rather highbrow TV show. All the questions relate to music, mainly classical music. Simple game, get the most questions right and you win.

Over 1,000 questions. Merit developed the game with the record company Decca, who is named on the box.

112182.name: Im Reich der Käfer und Schmetterlinge
112182.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 75)
simple 'Roll and Move' game
remarks:
very cute drawings
humanized animals
2 educational inserts about bugs & butterflies by manufacturer
6 very nice coloured pewter figures
should had been published between 1910-15

112183.name: The Mosaic Mage
112183.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Traditional wizards find magic in books, sorcerers in blood, and bards in music. The most powerful magical creatures of the Material Plane—dragons—find magic in color. Ignoring the traditional schools of magic, mosaic mages define spells by associated color. Red magic is violent and aggressive, but it also heals and loves. Both black magic and white magic are death, but one is also evil while the other good. Blue is mysticism, utility, and knowledge. Yellow is energy, enigmas, and light.

Mosaic mages prefer to identify themselves by the color in which they specialize. A mosaic mage who specializes in yellow magic, for example, prefers to be known as a yellow mage. So attuned to the color of magic in which they specialize, mosaic mages emanate a translucent aura that tints their skin and clothes. Although this tinted aura is not perceived any more powerfully by detect magic, it is obvious to the naked eye.

Ridiculed by the ignorant and magically sterile, mosaic mages of every color possess unique access to spells that are the envy of their bookish brethren. Red mages, for example, are among the few arcane casters with healing powers but who can also throw fire around better than divine healers. A minority among the already rare ranks of the mosaic mages are those who blend colors together to expand their access to magic, such as green mages, who can benefit from all magic associated with the mystical blue and enigmatic yellow spell spectrums. By studying the lessons of great wizards and historic artists, mosaic mages see magic in a different light.

112184.name: White Terrors of the North
112184.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Codex Draconis, the line of products that gives you what you need to drop dragons into your games with a minimum of effort and a maximum of options. Here, in the fifth volume of our line, we present options and alternatives for a dozen white dragons, covering every age category of the pale hunters of artic mountains, frozen deserts, and chilled tundra. Each age category also has three pregenerated treasure hoards, some alternative monster builds, and suggestions on how to build even deadlier dragon encounters.

Dragons are among the most iconic, and most popular, of all fantasy roleplaying game foes. Once the domain exclusively of higher-level adventures, dragons now have rules for every stage of life. This means that wet-behind-the-ears PCs can face dragons early in their careers (though likely they will be facing dragons the size of housecats). To ensure that a dragon is always just the right threat for PCs of any level, dragons are given twelve stages of life that, when combined with the many different types of dragons, creates a range of CRs from 2 to 22.

The problem with that, of course, is that it requires a lot of stat blocks, and those take up room. To save space, instead of presenting a full write-up of every dragon at every age category, the game’s creators present a set of rules outlining how to write up dragons, and then give a few examples of each type. As a result, although you can find a dragon of the right CR for an encounter, it takes a considerable amount of work to get that dragon ready for the game.

To help with that problem, the fine folks at D20PFSRD.com took on the job of creating full stat blocks for every true dragon of every type, and when we expressed an interest in using those as the starting point for our Codex Draconis line, they were kind enough to give us their blessing. In addition to their dragon write-ups, Codex Draconis: White Terrors of the North presents additional material to expand the ways you can use these dragons and allows you to drop them into your campaign.

112187.name: Aasimars, Tieflings, and Elemental Templates
112187.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever wanted to play an aasimar, tiefling or elemental-kin, but you also wanted to play a halfling or an elf? Or maybe you've just always wondered why, if outsiders regularly mate with humans to produce aasimars, tieflings and elemental-kin, why don't they do the same with dwarves, gnomes or even minotaurs? The answers to those questions are, you can and they do!

Player's Options: Aasimars, Tieflings, and Elemental Templates is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible product that turns each breed into a template that can be easily applied to any humanoid or monstrous humanoid race, allowing players to create halfling aasimar, half-orc tieflings, or djinni-kin minotaurs. Each of the three types is further broken down into multiple templates, depending on the exact lineage of the character, giving players a total of eighteen new options to customize their characters!

112188.name: Flaws
112188.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The heroes of fantasy gaming are perfect in every way. Except when they aren’t.

ééPlayer's Options: Flawséé introduces the concept of intentional imperfection for your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game character. From quirks like constantly stretching the truth when telling a story, to minor disabilities such as poor hearing, these optional flaws and the difficulties they cause add depth to your character’s personality and the roleplaying experience.

Just as those of us who have flaws of our own (which would be all of us!) are naturally stronger in other areas to compensate for our weaknesses, a character who takes a flaw gets an extra feat or three extra skill points. But the flaw itself bestows penalties – some minor, some quite significant. Is it a worthwhile price to pay for the bonuses? Only you can decide.

Each of the 49 flaws presented here is fully described with the penalties your character takes for having the flaw, as well as information on how they can eventually overcome their flaw. That is, if you want to get rid of the flaw at all. The challenge of roleplaying a rogue who needs spectacles to pick locks might just be too fun to resist!

112190.name: Bard Cards
112190.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bardic performances enhance your character’s powers, but keeping track of what song does what can be a pain...

Now, with Player’s Aid V: Bard Cards, you can easily keep track of all your bardic performances and abilities without having to keep multiple books open in front of you.

Player’s Aid V: Bard Cards includes all the core bard powers from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, as well as all alternate bard powers from Strategists & Tacticians and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Player's Guide.

Just print out the sheets, cut the cards apart, and you’re good to go, enhancing your party of adventurers quickly and easily with these handy Bard Cards!

112191.name: Wer Beobachtet Besser?
112191.description:
A game for two that tests your powers of observation. There are two decks of cards, 40 cards per deck. The cards show a grid of 6 squares 4 of which are blank and two have either a red triangle or a red circle, or, indeed, a blue triangle or a blue circle. Each card will have a red and a blue example of the shape.

Each player shuffles their deck and then gives it to his or her opponent. Interestingly, it is allowed to shuffle them with some cards the wrong way round. Not sure if this adds to the difficulty or not.

At the word Go, both players start searching through the deck they have been given. The object is to find a matching pair. No two cards are identical so a pair is two cards that have the two shapes reversed, so to speak. For example, if a card had a Blue triangle in the top left corner and a red circle in the bottom right corner, the the matching card will be one thast has a red triangle in the top left corner and a blue triangle in the bottom right corner.

The first player to match the 20 pairs available, wins

112192.description:
Sugar Gliders is a board game for two to four players. Each game lasts around 20 minutes. Each player has a sugar glider, that has to collect as many fruits as possible by jumping from branch to branch.

The sugar glider is a small marsupial that loves nectarous foods. As its name suggests, it’s capable of gliding through the air, much like a flying squirrel.

COMPONENTS

- A board depicting a tree with 61 cells.
- 4 sugar gliders in different colours.
- 60 food tiles in 5 types: 1 fruit, 2 fruits, 3 fruits, 4 fruits, 1 big fruit (5 points).
- A carrying case.

GAME PREPARATION

Each player chooses a player color and takes the corresponding sugar glider.

Leaving the center space empty, randomly distribute the 60 tiles face-up to the 60 other spaces on the tree, 1 per space.

White starts by choosing any space with a white fruit (value 1 tile), and placing his sugar glider on it. The tile in that space will be his ‘jumping tile’. In turn, the other players do the same.

The game can start now. White plays first.

GAME RULES

The game is played in turns, counterclockwise. On your turn, you must either make your sugar glider jump or go into a brief state of torpor:

JUMP

Move your sugar glider in a straight line a number of spaces equal to your ‘jumping tile’ (this means one space in the first turn). If you have no ‘jumping tile’ underneath your sugar glider, you must use one from your reserve. Notice that purple fruits count as 5 movement points.

Then you take the ‘jumping tile’ that you just used, and put it beside yourself face-up. This is your ‘reserve’. If you had no ‘jumping tile’ underneath your sugar glider and had to use a tile from your reserve, discard this tile to the game case; it cannot be used again for the rest of the game.

The tile on which your sugar glider has landed (if any) is your new ‘jumping tile’.

Exceptions:

- The sugar gliders cannot jump outside the tree.
- A sugar glider sitting in the center space can jump to any space on the board by spending any tile from his reserve (no need to match the length of the jump).
- A sugar glider cannot move through another sugar glider.

Example: Anna wishes to make her sugar glider jump, but there is no ‘jumping tile’ underneath her sugar glider. She uses a ‘2’ from her reserve, moves the sugar glider 2 spaces in a straight line, and discards the tile she’s used to the case.

TORPOR

You don’t move your sugar glider. Take the ‘jumping tile’ from underneath your sugar glider (if there is one), and add it to your reserve.

GAME END

The game ends when all the sugar gliders are consecutively in a state of torpor, or when the tree runs out of tiles, whichever happens first.

Each player sums the values of the tiles in his reserve (purple tiles count as 5 points). Highest score wins. In case of a tie, play again.

VARIANT FOR 2 PLAYERS

For shorter 2-player games, discard all the purple fruit tiles and 3 tiles of each other value. Then play on the inner board.
112192.name: Sugar Gliders

112193.name: Spawn
112193.description:
This video game is based on the comic series of the same name.
The game is a typical side-scrolling combat game. It follows very closely the story arc laid out in the original comics: Spawn has to rescue some kids from an evil demon.

Source: Wikipedia, "Todd McFarlane's Spawn: The Video Game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112194.name: Spectre
112194.description:
The goal of the game was to drive the tank around the playfield, collecting ten flags by driving over them, while avoiding obstacles (including rotating windmills) and the shots of computer-generated enemy tanks.

In single player mode, you can choose four kinds of tanks, which one having different stats for shields (it's like armor), speed and ammo: Balance, Speedy, Strong and Custom (you can freely distribute 15 stat points for this one). Each stage passed increases game's difficulty (quantity and speed of enemy tanks). Furthermore, from level 6 appear yellow tanks (which are faster and more resistant than normal enemy red tanks) and every 10 levels the shields of all enemy tanks are increased by 1. Also, you can throw grenades after level 9 passed, with a cost of 10 ammo, which damages all enemy tanks in his explosive range.

The game supported multiplayer operation over an AppleTalk network. Each player used a single Mac, but the other players were depicted as enemy tanks.

The original Spectre is often confused with the 1994 Spectre VR, an enhanced network-oriented version of the game. It and Spectre Supreme were also available for PC-compatible computers, but only Spectre was available for the Nintendo Super NES video game console.

Source: Wikipedia, "Spectre (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112195.name: Speed Racer in My Most Dangerous Adventures
112195.description:
Speed Racer in My Most Dangerous Adventures combines elements of racing and platform gaming. The game serves as the professional debut of composer Marc Baril. Speed has to take his trusty car, the Mach 5, to travel the world and win every grand prix there is. Infamous villians from the animated series are out there to capture Trixy, Speed's girlfriend, and he must stop them all.

Source: Wikipedia, "Speed Racer in My Most Dangerous Adventures", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112196.name: Star Fox: Super Weekend
112196.description:
A promotional cartridge, Super Star Fox Weekend (Official Competition) (titled Star Wing: Official Competition (Official Competition) in Europe), was released as part of the game's marketing campaign in Europe and the US. It featured time-limited single player mode on modified stages, as well as an exclusive bonus level.

In the United States, the Super Star Fox Weekend was played by tens of thousands of competitors in malls across the country. Stores such as KB Toys and Suncoast Video (usually any store that carried Super Nintendo games participated) hosted the event. After the competition, a limited number of the Super Weekend cartridges were sold through the Nintendo Power magazine.

Nintendo Netherlands also held the Starwing competition at various game selling stores in early 1993. The winner of each day won a large Starwing poster. Starwing competition was also used during the Dutch Nintendo Championship in October 1993-1996.

Source: Wikipedia, "StarFox (SNES)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112198.name: Sterling Sharpe: End 2 End
112198.description:
This video game was endorsed by retired NFL wide receiver Sterling Sharpe (his career with the Green Bay Packers ended in 1994 due to a neck injury). The game was rated Kids to Adults by the Entertainment Software Ratings Board advisory panel. The object is to win football games by following and complying with the standard rules of the National Football League. Referees deliver penalties to players (human or CPU) who commit penalties; these always carry either a five-yard penalty or a ten-yard penalty depending on the severity of the offence.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sterling Sharpe: End 2 End", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112199.name: L'Oeil De Set
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
112199.description:
User Summary

The Eye of Set, the scepter of the count of Okknokk has been stolen by the necromancer Atrackses. The mighty warrior Tyrkos has been asked to travel to Atrackses' subterranean fortress and return with the scepter.

L'Oeil de Set ("the Eye of Set") is a fantasy adventure implemented like a choose-your-own-adventure gamebook. The player leads Tyrkos in his quest for the scepter by picking an action among those offered by the game. The program keeps track of 2 variables, "energie" (Tyrkos' hit points) and "alerte" (the chance of encountering a guard patrol in the part of the fortress Tyrkos is in). There are also 4 labyrinths to navigate (maps are included in the game's manual).

112200.description:
Adventures in the Zoallan Navy

This supplement expands Battlestations to include a campaign based on characters in the Zoallan navy fighting for the right to mate with the queen. It includes rules for the line of succession and special abilities, equipment and new scenarios.
112200.name: Battlestations: By Her Majesty's Sacred Egg Sac

112201.name: Kinetic
videogameversion: UK Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
112201.description:
User Summary

The laws of motion of the universe have been tampered with, and the world is in chaos. The only way to restore order is to find the word of peace and bring it to the Kinemator, who will be able to once again control the forces of the cosmos.

Kinetik is a side-view arcade-adventure game. The player must explore the 43 screens of the world, collect the letters of the word PAX in the correct order and bring them back to the Kinemator. Control of the player's craft is difficult at first, but items can be picked up that nullify some of the external factors, like gravity, inertia or friction. Other items include a defence shield or a chemical sprayer to defend against the many enemies.
