As each piece of equipment adds to the power consumption, the player must often recharge the craft's batteries by finding a pool of water and landing on it, or picking up flowers. Scattered across the levels are teleporters, which allow a player to quickly move from a screen to another.

112202.name: Reingefallen
112202.description:
Objective: move as many as possible of your meeples into the middle of the board (safe)
- moving by turns - surviving seems to be very tough
1 each player starts with (only) one meeple at his (coloured) base
2 roll the die and move a. your meeple b. turn the wheel according the die
3a if your meeple falls into a hole - bad luck
3b if your meeple is still 'on board' ==> next player
3c if your meeple reaches the middle - safe; put a new one onto the board if you have remaining moves
4 thrown out meeples (not dropped) may start again (home base)
5 game ends if all meeples dropped/are safe

There are 2 different editions: small ==> max 4 player 245/I
large: max 6 player 245/H; if you play with more than 4 players you should fix/tape one hole
game was published during 1930's

112203.name: Sabotage (Amstrad CPC)
112203.description:
User Summary

Sabotage is a top-down shoot'em up with puzzle elements. The player controls a spacecraft and must fight wave after wave of enemy ships to reach the end of the level. Between each level is a puzzle sequence in which the player must navigate a top-down maze and pickup a piece of blueprint while dodging enemy drones falling down from the top of the screen. Once the maze sequence is completed, the player is given a code for the next level. At the end of the final level, the player has collected enough blueprint pieces to find the weakness in the enemy's mothership and destroy it once and for all.

112204.name: Bionic Ninja
112204.description:
User Summary

The Icarus earth defence base is under attack. Ninjabot 1 is deployed, his orders are to inflitrate the base and eradicate the alien infestation.

Bionic Ninja is a budget run-and-gun game by Zeppelin. The player controls a robotic ninja and must travel through four levels, fighting aliens on the way. The robot can use shurikens, a katana and a variety of close-combat attacks (high kick, punch, low kick).

112205.name: Formula One
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum (Mastertronic Re-release) Cassette edition
112205.description:
User Summary

This game was originally released for the 16 and 48K ZX Spectrums as "Formula One" by Spirit Software. It was later re-released by Mastertronic as "Formula 1 Simulator" and converted to a variety of systems.

As the name implies, it is a Formula One simulation game. The player has a choice between ten tracks and either an automatic or manual gear box.

The original Spirit Software release came packaged with a steering wheel which attached to the Spectrum. Essentially this was a plastic, ashtray shaped device, which the player rolled along the top row of keys. The further rolled away from the centre keys, the greater the steering lock. The Mastertronic release did not include the steering wheel, but it remains a control option in the ZX Spectrum menus. The manual instead includes instructions for making your own 'steering wheel' out of a roll of sellotape.

112206.name: Paragliding Simulation
112206.description:
User Summary

A paragliding simulation developed by Jean-Philippe Biscay for Loriciel, with the help of the French Paragliding Federation.

The game uses a side scrolling view. It includes a practice mode, and four different landscapes (French Mont Blanc, Grand Canyon, Himalaya and Peru). The player must complete the practice mode to gain access to the rest of the game.

The game manual includes lengthy explanations about the theory behind paragliding (air currents, sail size...)

112207.name: Russian Dancing Men
112207.description:
User Summary

Russian Dancing game is a rhythm game based on Weebl's Stuff popular flash animations. Each level is full of obstacles placed to follow the rhythm of the song. Obstacles must be avoided by pressing the correct key or a combination of two, with bonus points awarded for precise timing and successful streaks. The game features nine songs, specially remixed to enhance gameplay.

List of songs:
- Russian Dancing Men
- Crabs
- Magical Trevor
- Anywhere
- Badgers
- Kenya
- Amazing Horse
- Narwhals
- Motherland

Non-remixed versions of the songs can be found either at Weebl's Stuff site or Youtube channel. Motherland was composed for the game and isn't available on the net.

112208.name: Corsarios
112208.description:
User Summary

Corsarios ("corsairs") is a pirate-themed beat'em up by Spanish game studio Opera Soft. Like many other Spanish games of the era, the game is split in two parts. In the first, the character must travel through the jungle and an abandoned fort to reach the port. The character is unarmed and must battle hordes of pirates, bomb-throwers, arquebusiers and other enemies. The second part takes place aboard the Queen Opera pirate ship. The character is armed with a cutlass and must take control of the ship by lowering the flag on each of its masts. Once done, the character must defeat a boss before he can finally free his fiance.

112209.name: Cosa Nostra
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC 3" Floppy Disk edition
Spanish Amstrad CPC 3" Floppy Disk edition
112209.description:
User Summary

A run-and-gun game set in 1920's Chicago. The city mayor has had enough of the criminal empire run by the Cosa Nostra and asks the famous detective Mike Bronco to put a stop to hit.

The players controls Mike Bronco. The trench-coat wearing detective must travel through the 92 screens of the game, battle mafia goons and crooked cops and eliminate the five bosses that control the criminal underworld.

112210.description:
Welcome to the future

The year is 2033. The world is in ruins. All the major cities have been wiped away by a nuclear war. Flooded with radiation, the planet surface is largely unfit for life. Handfuls of survivors have found refuge in antinuclear bunkers, the largest of which is the Moscow Metro. The Metro has become humanity’s last haven after Judgment Day.

Metro 2033 is based on the popular Metro 2033 universe created by Russian writer and journalist Dmitry Glukhovsky. After the nuclear strike, thousands of survivors have found refuge in the Moscow underground (a.k.a., the Metro) — the biggest shelter in the world. In the stations and tunnels deep below the surface a new civilization emerges.

Gameplay

Each player is a leader of one of the many factions of post-nuclear underground. In order to win, a faction has to achieve ten victory points (VPs). Each station under the faction's control gives it 1 VP; different quests also bring VPs when completed. The other way to win is to capture all four stations of Polis — the cultural and political heart of Metro. Each faction has a hero at its disposal. Heroes can travel the underground, gain quests and equipment that increases their abilities, fight opponents' heroes, attack stations, and so on. The army of a faction can also attack stations, and usually with better chances to win, but it can target only adjacent stations. Stations under factions' control produce resources — pigs, ammo and mushrooms — that are used to capture new stations, strenghten the army, buy equipment and obtain quests. The production of resources and other game events are determined by a special sequence. This sequence tells what will happen each round: production of certain recources, a vote for a new law, or a sudden attack from the dark that must be repelled.

Players can attack stations with their armies or their heroes. Both have strength that may be increased by hiring new troops or buying useful equipment. When attacking a neutral station, the army/hero fights a random threat from the special deck and has to beat its strength. When attacking an opponent, the attacker confronts his army or hero. In battles between players a special set of combat cards is used; these cards give various bonuses to strength depending on the card chosen by the opponent, so the goal is to deduce which combat card will be used by the other side.
112210.name: Metro 2033

112211.name: Stone Protectors
112211.description:
A Super Nintendo game was released in November 1994 by Kemco. A Sega Mega Drive/Genesis version was developed and completed, but not released. This version, intended to be published by Vic Tokai, was made when ESRB was in place and had a T rating. It featured alternate case and cartridge artwork than the SNES version. The fully finished Mega Drive/Genesis prototype was finally leaked to the public domain in 2010.

Stone Protectors features 10 levels in which the heroes - Clifford, Cornelius, Chester, Maxwell, and Angus - battle The Predators throughout their mission to retrieve Zok's crystal and bring them all back to the kingdom. Weapons can also be acquired but only used by certain characters. Depending on the difficulty setting, the game's ending scene also features different music in which the Stone Protectors are seen performing as a band.

Source: Wikipedia, "Stone Protectors", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112212.name: Street Combat
112212.description:
The first fighting game for the SNES by NCS Corp, Neighborhood Combat Chapter underwent Americanization by Irem to become Street Combat, replacing all characters and background music with American-themed characters. An example is Ranma, who was replaced by a blonde man in bright blue armor called Steven. This is the only fighting game in which Cologne appears.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Ranma ½ video games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112213.name: Wir reisen mit Karl May -Vom Sinai zum Tigris-
112213.description:
Object of the game:
Be the first to reach field no 100

Simple 'Roll and Move' game
based on the book/story of 'Karl May',
well known German novelist;
Schmidt aquired rights to publish Game
edition is equipped with 6 cute pewter figures.

112214.name: Street Hockey '95
112214.description:
Street Hockey '95 is a roller hockey video game for the Super NES that takes place in an urban environment. Instead of ice, the players play on cement and instead of ice skates, they use rollerblades. Players assemble their squads from nine hockey players who are savvy in the ways of the street. There are six different kinds of urban arenas and five different variations on the "traditional" road hockey game. Street Hockey '95 uses more than two thousand frames of digitized animation; making it relatively advanced for its era.

Source: Wikipedia, "Street Hockey '95", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112215.name: Tom Clancy's Endwar (DS/PSP)
videogamehonor: 2008 Game Critics Best Simulation Game of the Year Winner
2008 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Winner
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
112215.description:
From the back of the box:

WORLD WAR III IS IN YOUR HANDS

2020: the world's economic and civil order is shaken by an unprecedented energy crises re-igniting the arms race between the United States of America, Russia and Europe. Pick your side!

User Summary:

Differing from the console and PC version, the DS edition is a turn-based strategy game played on a hex map through the three campaigns. Two players can do battle in local multiplayer, but each must have their own copy of the game.

112216.name: Super Bases Loaded
112216.description:
Super Bases Loaded is a Super NES baseball video game. This game is known as Super Professional Baseball (スーパープロフェッショナルベースボール) in Japan.The game is the fifth overall installment of the Bases Loaded series, and first installment of the secondary series for the Super Nintendo.

When the player loses a game, the player is disqualified and he/she is sent back to the title screen to try again on the lowest level of play. When the player wins the game however, the game gives the player a score between 0 and 100.

Getting 100 once takes you to the toughest level, where getting the perfect 100 score again means that the player has defeated the game and credits start to appear. Achieving a score lower than normal, gets the player demoted to a lower level and a stern message from the invisible drill instructor that is the game. However, getting a higher score than normal gets the player promoted to the next level and admirations from the game itself.

The advertising in the game consists of spoofs from actual companies that were in existence in the early 1990s. The language of the advertisements are in English in the North American version while the Japanese version (called Super Professional Baseball) has most of its advertisements in Japanese. In addition to this, home run messages appear in either English or Japanese, depending on what version the player has. The player has two edit teams and he/she can edit the names of the player and career statistics in an attempt to either improve the batter/pitcher or to deliberately make him perform worse on the field.

Teams
Atlanta Amoebas
Boston Buzzards
Chicago Cyclops
New York Mercs
Philadelphia Hawks
Washington Weasels
Hawaii Islanders
Kansas City Kings
Los Angeles Lizards
Seattle Storm
Texas Tornados
Utah Stars

The player can also edit their own team in this game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Bases Loaded", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112217.name: The Lord of the Rings: Conquest (DS)
112217.description:
In the Nintendo DS version, gameplay features are greatly reduced. The Scout class is unavailable and mounts are non-existent. In addition, the playing perspective is isometric and only 6 maps were shipped with the game. All classes start out relatively weak, but fallen enemies will drop orbs that allow the player to power-up their current character’s attack power and speed, resetting after the player respawns. After a level is over, a post-game statistics screen will appear to show the player’s performance and to award them in-game achievements for their accomplishments (not allowing allies to die, for instance).[9]

Source: Wikipedia, "The lord of the rings conquest", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the back of the box:

SAVE MIDDLE-EARTH...OR DESTROY IT

Fight for Good or Evil as one of three classes.

112218.name: Super Bases Loaded 2
112218.description:
Super Bases Loaded 2 (known in Japan as Super 3D Baseball -- not Super Professinal Baseball 2, which is a different game) is a Super NES baseball game. The game is the sixth overall installment of the Bases Loaded series, and second installment of the secondary series for the Super Nintendo's Super Bases Loaded.

The battery backup allowed players to save several categories of statistics for all 14 teams in the two leagues and not just their own. The DSP chip allowed a rudimentary 3-D perspective for batting and sometimes infield play. When players swung, their own individual numbers appeared on the back of their jerseys.

There were seven teams each in the "Alpha League" and the "Omega League" that went by city names only, and often borrowed symbols from those of the original Super Bases Loaded. The nicknames in quotation marks are those of the original SBL teams for whom the symbols were based, but do not appear in the game. The Alpha League consisted of the Boston "Kings," the Chicago "Lizards," the Cleveland "Stars," the Detroit "Storm," the Kansas City "Tornadoes", Oakland "Eagles", and Seattle "Blue Wave". The Omega League consisted of the Atlanta "Weasels," Houston "Doves", the Los Angeles "Cyclops," the New York "Mercs," Philadelphia "Bruins", the Pittsburgh "Buzzards," and the San Francisco "Amoebas." In addition, there were four edit teams: Urbana, Rockford, Peoria, and Aurora.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Bases Loaded 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112219.name: Super Professional Baseball II
112219.description:
Super Professional Baseball II (スーパープロフェッショナルベースボール２, "Super Professional Baseball 2") is a sequel to Super Professional Baseball, although the next game in the Bases Loaded Series is Super 3D Baseball so it is also a sequel.

Although Super Professional Baseball was the basis for the North American port called Super Bases Loaded, Super Professional Baseball II is a significantly different game than Super Bases Loaded 2. The end result of either winning a single game or winning the championship is fireworks followed by a ticker-tape parade.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Professional Baseball II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112220.name: Wir Lernen Spielend Rechtschreibung
112220.description:
Game designed to let children test their powers of the German language.

The cards are dealt out evenly (any number can play). In a turn, a player must ask another player to answer correctly the top card in one of three categories; Words that end in g or ch? Words that end in g or k? Words that end in s or z?

If a player answers with the correct spelling ending, he puts the card to his right. If he gets it wrong, it goes to his left. If a player runs out of cards, he must pick up all the cards to his left and play on. The game ends when one player has all his cards to the right and none in his hand.

112221.name: Super Bases Loaded 3
112221.description:
The game is the sixth overall installment of the Bases Loaded series, and third installment of the secondary trilogy for the Super Nintendo.

Super Bases Loaded 3 was licensed by the Major League Baseball Players Association (MLBPA) and uses real MLB players, but it wasn't licensed by Major League Baseball (MLB). All 28 U.S. cities that had a MLB team at the time are listed but team names and logos are not given. No real stadiums are used and the World Series is renamed the championship tournament.

Notable baseball players in the game include: Barry Bonds, Kirby Puckett, and Terry Gwynn.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Bases Loaded 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112222.name: Super Batter Up
112222.description:
All 26 Major League Baseball teams and their players from the 1991 Major League Baseball season are present in this game. This includes players like Cal Ripken, Dave Winfield, and Kirby Puckett. Players get to play in either a dome, modern, or traditional stadium each with their own unique characteristics. The game uses the modified version of the Joystix font that was popular in 1980s video games. Players are shown standing up for the national anthem of both the United States and Canada (for games played in Toronto with the mighty and awe-inspiring Blue Jays). They can also choose to substitute a hitter or a runner while at bat.

All game stats are shown on the fictitious newspaper, known as the Namco Sports paper. Players are permitted to zoom in and out of the paper to look for minor details. The words "game over" appear on the screen regardless of whether the player wins or loses a game. Passwords can be entered to restore progress in the game.

Both one-player and two-player modes integrates the traditional playing mode of the game. If the player wins the single-player tournament, then he can see the ending. The battle mode becomes a single-game mode when two players are playing.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Batter Up", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112223.name: Super Battletank
112223.description:
Super Battletank takes place during Operation Desert Storm. The player controls an M1 Abrams main battle tank for the United Nations. The player battles helicopter gunships, T72's, and Scud launchers, in pursuit of a military victory.

The screen is divided into two sections. One is the instrument panel in the gunner's station of the tank, and the other is a view of the outside, which consists primarily of the desert and military vehicles.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Battletank", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112224.name: Ulises
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC 3" Floppy Disk edition
112224.description:
User Summary

Ulises is a side-scrolling run-and-gun game loosely inspired by Greek mythology. The hero Ulysses must rescue twelve virgins captured by Circé the sorcerer. He'll have to battle numerous monsters along the way, jump platforms and climb ropes.

112225.name: Super Battletank 2
112225.description:
Super Battletank 2 is a 1994 Super Nintendo Entertainment System-only video game that was released in North America, Europe, and Japan.

The game is the sequel to Super Battletank, and the player controls a M1A2 Battletank. There are 16 missions, all located in the Middle East.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Battletank 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112227.name: Soviet
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC 3" Floppy Disk edition
112227.description:
User Summary

Several of the Republics of the USSR are in open revolt. They have seized weapons from the Soviet army and fight against Russia, while behind their borders, massacres of pro-Russian groups are reported. You are sent behind the frontline to save the citizens still loyal to the USSR.

In Soviet the player controls a combat vehicle (top-down view). The goal is to pick up as much hostages as possible before being detected by an enemy patrol. Once the player is detected, enemy forces converge on the location, making the rescue operation much more difficult. There are four stages in the game, the player proceeds to the next by rescueing at least 31 hostages (there are 50 hostages per level and the game is lost if 20 of them are killed).

112228.name: Frontline
112228.description:
User Summary

Frontline is a budget shooter from Zeppelin Games. The player controls a soldier (top-down view) who must find a bag containing a map, then find the entrance to the next level. The soldier can pick up power-ups (better rate of fire, extra mines) and health elixir to regain hot points. Enemies include foot soldiers, pillboxes, tanks, motorcycles, trucks...

112229.name: Magical Chase
112229.description:
From the back of the box:

Ripple is a student of magic, and her teacher is a terrifying witch! Ripple's particularly afraid of her teacher right now, because she's just broken a promise she made to the witch; Ripple took a peek inside the forbidden book Sleeping Demons! No sooner had she opened the cover than out jumped six demons, which raced away! Unless she can catch all six demons and get them back inside the book, the witch will turn Ripple into a frog for breaking her promise! Ripple sets off on her quest with her two Elf-Star friends, Topsy and Turvy. Good luck, Ripple!!

112230.name: Over and Under
112230.description:
Over and Under is a child's "First Game of Fractions".

From Publisher Page:
Players place one die over or under another die to create a proper or improper fraction in this multi-leveled game of beginning fractions. Then place a marble over or under that fraction on the game board to knock their opponents out or capture the fraction for themselves. For the biggest challenge, be the first player to capture a combination of proper fractions that will make a whole number.

The game is available in a wooden board version and a Masonite board wipe-off version, for use with crayons or water-based overhead markers.

Wooden Version Includes:
- 12" x 12" x 3/4" Birch Game Board
- 80 Glass Marbles (4 colors).
- 4 Marble Trays
- Dice
- Directions
- Game Box

Masonite Version Includes:
- 11" x 11" x 1/8" Masonite board
- Dice
- Directions

112231.name: Mazie
112231.description:
User Summary

Mazie is a budget Breakout clone by Zeppelin Games. Its most notable feature is the huge number of different bonuses and special bricks. The levels are not played sequentially; rather, each level is linked to four other levels and which one is the next is determined semi-randomly.

112232.name: Down and Around
112232.description:
Down and Around is a game that teaches "The FUN-da-Mentals of Fractions".

From Publisher Website:
Players use our original Fraction Ladder to easily find the Greatest Common Factor (GCF) and Least Common Multiple (LCM) of 2 numbers rolled on the 6- and 12-sided dice. Then players use their answers to be the first to fill-in 9 of their 12 spaces. For a more challenging level players compete to get 3 in a row on either side of the board using both offensive and defensive strategy.

This game comes in a wooden board version and a Masonite board version, for use with crayons or water-based overhead markers.

Wood Version Includes:
- 12" x 12" x 3/4" Birch Game Board
- 80 Glass Marbles (4 colors).
- 4 Marble Trays
- Dice
- Directions
- Game Box

Masonite Version Includes:
- 11" x 11" x 1/8" Masonite board
- Dice
- Directions

112233.description:
FrankenDie is a fast-paced, reflex party game for the whole family! Combining the tactile nature of dice rolling, the excitement of a "first to buzz in" mechanism, and pattern recognition that is sure to exercise your brain, FrankenDie will bring your party or game-night to life!

THEME: You are a Mad Scientist competing to assemble a Creature from serviceable body parts scavenged from the graveyard. Once your Creature has a "lightly used" head, body, two arms, two legs and the all-important brain, it's time to re-animate it with a charge of lightning and a cry of... "It's Aliiiiiive!"

GAME PLAY: Players take turns rolling the dice and looking for a set to call out. For instance: "3 Brains!" But all players are competing to call out a set AND be the first to place a hand on the graveyard. If you're successful, you get to keep the body part you spotted. Assemble a full creature, then call out a set of lightning to bring it to life!

Now, this is no walk in the graveyard. No sir. Because when you're a mad scientist, it can cost an arm and a leg to get a head. If you want to build the Creature of your dreams, you'll have to know when to make a mad dash to the graveyard, and when to wait out your trigger-happy, mistake prone colleagues.

So get a head start, and show your friends that your genius is beyond compare.
112233.name: FrankenDie
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

112234.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 2 No 3 - Fall 2038)
112234.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Milestones, In the Arena, On the Road, The Showroom, Local Hero, Editorial, & Closing Shots.

112235.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 2 No 4 - Winter 2038)
112235.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Milestones, Meeting the Group, In the Arena, On the Road, The Showroom, Local Hero, & Closing Shots.

112236.name: Fall Gelb
112236.description:
User Summary

The Fall of France, spring 1940. You are placed in command of the forces of France, England, Belgium, the Netherlands, and Germany when the storm broke in May 1940. Note: This is a hybrid game than requires a computer, map & counters to play. By Les Howie

112237.name: Battle of the Atlantic
112237.description:
User Summary

A Full scale, complex strategic simulation of the struggle for control of the sea lanes from North Africa to England and Russia that raged from 1939 to 1944. Note that this is a hybrid game that requires a computer, map & counters. By Les Howie and Stephen Newberg.

112238.name: Grey Seas, Grey Skies
112238.description:
User Summary

The representation of modern naval combat at the tactical level. Covers submarines, surface ships, and aircraft in a highly realistic and accurate manner. Note this is a hybrid game. By W.J. Nichols

112239.name: Long Lance
videogamehonor: 1987 Charles S. Roberts Best Twentieth Century Computer Wargame Nominee
112239.description:
User Summary

Long Lance is a detailed game type simulation of the naval battles in Iron Bottom Sound between August, 1942 and February, 1943, as well as a scenario generator capable of creating hypothetical Pacific naval actions during 1942. Note this is a hybrid game.

112240.name: Golan Front
112240.description:
User Summary

The 1973 Arab/Israeli war in the north. Note this is a hybrid game. By W.J. Nichols

112241.name: Main Battle Tank Central Germany
112241.description:
User Summary

Modern grand tactical combat. A High speed command oriented, viewpoint style study of the first clashes of the Third World War in Europe. By Stephen Newberg and Stephen St. John

112242.name: Northern Fleet
112242.description:
User Summary

A detailed simulation of modern naval operations in the North Atlantic. At dawn on 27 March 1996, a Soviet regiment with the support of an air assault battalion captured the Svalbard Archipelago. The Battle for the Norwegian Sea is on.

112243.name: Rommel at Gazala
112243.description:
User Summary

The battles for Tobruk, 26 May - 27 June, 1942. Note this is a hybrid game.

112244.name: Stalingrad Campaign
112244.description:
User Summary

A detailed game type simulation of the battles in southern Russia between June 1942 and February 1943. The players have the viewpoint of the Chief of the General Staff for each side, and are directly accountable to Hitler or Stalin.

112245.name: Seventh Fleet
112245.description:
User Summary

A look at the Pacific, where for a number of years the USSR has been building up its naval forces as a counter to the US Seventh Fleet. The game builds on this situation to model current naval strategic operations. By W.J. Nichols.

112246.name: Siege in Afrika
112246.description:
User Summary

The war in North Africa 1940 - 1943. Operational game of the campaign in North Africa from the first Italian advances of 1940 through the final battles of 1943. By J. Kula

112247.name: Disciples III: Resurrection
112247.description:
This is a new landmark in the history of Nevendaar, when a new race ascends to power - the ruthless and merciless Undead Hordes. It is the story of selfless love and unfading glory. Heroes of the past, who had lost their lives, but not their sentience, are exacting their revenge in the name of Mortis, the Goddess of Death.

Key features:

- The most expected race - The Undead Hordes, which has been the mostly anticipated race among the gamers and fans of the Disciples series
- Over 70 hours of gameplay. This is even more than in the previous game in the series - Disciples 3: Renaissance!
- 2 storyline characters, 4 leaders of the Undead Hordes, 2 bosses and over 50 new units.
- Revised gameplay balance.
- Famous distinct gothic atmosphere. Unique style and design. Detailed and realistic world.
- The plot of the game was written by Ekaterina Stadnikova, author of the most popular book based on the series.
- Dramatic and intriguing plot.
- Well thought-out and interesting quests

Source: The Game Website.

112248.name: Airline Tycoon 2
112248.description:
A decade after the best-selling Airline Tycoon comes the long awaited sequel to the legendary tongue-in-cheek economic simulation that puts players in the role of CEO of an international airline! Airline Tycoon 2 will challenge players to run a modern airline, design unique airplanes and grow a run-down carrier into a globally recognized company that passengers practically beg to fly. Airports worldwide are waiting to be explored, but beware– your rivals never rest! Crafty opponents are also working to dominate the skies... and they won’t let anything stand in the way of their goals!

Features:

- Explore real world airports, from Moscow to New York, with realistic travel conditions and passenger volumes
- Build your ideal fleet of planes – use the in-game editor to craft inexpensive mass-transportation “Greyhounds in the sky” or unique, luxury jets that spoil the elite
- Jump into the action as one of four playable avatars with unique strengths and weaknesses
- Explore your home airport in full 3D, while bossing your employees around and expanding your blossoming airline; you might even meet VIPs at the airport lounge
- Test your management mettle in a challenging business environment as you schedule flight plans, coordinate arrivals and departures and balance income and expenses – all to grow profit and enhance your airline’s global reputation
- Random events bring variety to the game – The Pope wants a special flight? Civil unrest in a global hotspot? Volcanic ash clouds above Europe? If you act quickly, you can profit from these events!
- Sabotage – annoy and slow down your opponents with devious actions. But beware; your adversaries may just pay you back in kind!

Source: The Game Website.

112249.name: Blackwell Deception
112249.description:
Street psychics. Their blinking neon signs are everywhere, promising love and wealth and happiness. They make a fortune preying on the gullible and milking them dry. So when these victims begin dying and leaving confused spirits behind, it can only take a genuine psychic (and her wayward spirit guide) to clean up the mess.

From seedy downtown nightclubs to penthouse apartments to a luxury yacht on the Hudson River, Rosa and Joey will unearth the truth about the underground world of street psychics. Including some secrets that Joey would rather be left buried.

Source: The Game Website.

112250.name: Sacra Terra: Angelic Night
112250.description:
Defeat the demons of the Seven Deadly Sins and rescue humanity by uncovering spine-chilling clues in this Collector's Edition of SACRA TERRA: ANGELIC NIGHT that includes extended gameplay and much more.

When a magic ritual spirals out of control, the demons of the Seven Deadly Sins break out of their fiery prison and take up residence in a dilapidated mental hospital! If no one stops them, they will unleash a wave of destruction that will annihilate mankind. Will you be able to resist their offers of sinful pleasures and untold riches? As you explore all the eerie catacombs, you will learn who opened the portal between worlds. Along the way, you'll receive help from a pure spirit known only as Angel. Who she is and what happened to her is just one of the shocking truths you will uncover as you find well-hidden clues, gather useful items, and solve designed puzzles.

This Collector's Edition of SACRA TERRA: ANGELIC NIGHT contains a bonus chapter with a shocking connection to the main game, a step-by-step walkthrough, and much more! Can you overcome the demons of the Seven Deadly Sins and save the world? Pray you do!

Source: The Game Website.

112251.name: Duke Nukem Forever: Hail to the Icons Parody Pack
112251.description:
Three All-New Modes. Freeze Tag provides some of the most fun team gameplay in Duke Nukem Forever. Players cooperate to freeze and shatter their opponents in succession for huge point streaks and combos. See who can hold on to the babe the longest in Hot Potato and play free-for-all Duke style in Hail to the King.

Call of Duke – Duke engages in modern combat in a war-torn city. Foes don't stand a chance against the Duke when he spams the map with the N00b T00b.

Inferno – Time machine engage! Duke does combat in a hellish landscape of lava and teleporters. Who turned on the 16-bit graphics, and more importantly, where did this DFG come from?

Sandpit – Players take the role of mini-Duke in a giant sandbox with two bases at either end made out of children's toys. This map features Sticky Bombs.

2Forts1Bridge – Hats? Duke loves hats. Give him a minigun and take down all comers.

Source: The Game Website.

112252.name: Star Legends: The Blackstar Chronicles
112252.description:
Star Legends is a brand new ‘massively-multiplayer’ adventure from the creators of the mobile MMO sensation “Pocket Legends!” PLAY FOR FREE with family and friends, and make new friends online by joining forces with thousands (and thousands) of players from around the world.

You’d think the depths of space would be pretty empty… but you’d be wrong! After centuries of exploration, mankind learns that the ‘void’ is actually chock-full of hideous monsters, psychotic robots, blood-thirsty pirates and evil corporations. Good people from all corners of the galaxy need heroes – like YOU – to take arms against this constant tide of violence and to preserve humanity against its many threats!

Go aboard the “UCS BLACKSTAR” – a colonial super-carrier in the furthest reaches of space. Surrounded by mutant aliens, corrupted by criminal pirates, and controlled by opportunists… It’s the sort of place where a hero – like YOU – can find a lot of action and earn a LOT of credits!

Source: The Game Website.

112253.name: Rise! The Ballistic Expansion Pack
boardgameversion: Crash Games Kickstarter Backer Reward edition
112253.description:
Rise! The Ballistic Expansion Pack is an expansion to Rise!

This was an expansion available to Kickstarter Backers of Crash Games' November 2011 Kickstarter Campaign for Rise!

Rise! The Ballistic Expansion Pack adds three new types of pieces with a more "take that" element to Rise!

The Anchor Piece- The Anchor Piece is nearly an immovable object. The Anchor Piece doesn't move except when he meets another one of our special pieces which we'll get to in just a minute. The Anchor Piece can wreak quite a bit of havoc when placed near an opponent's freshly laid foundation of one of their towers.

The Flash Piece - The Flash Piece moves in quickly and is gone in a flash! When placed The Flash Piece wipes out everything that is on the six tiles that surround it, except towers. Use The Flash Piece wisely though because no one's workers are safe when The Flash Piece arrives!

The Vortex Piece - The Vortex Piece swallows everything in its path! When placed the Vortex Piece begins its timer and your opponent has four turns to disarm The Vortex Piece. If The Vortex Piece isn't disarmed, on the fifth turn after placement, the Vortex Piece wipes everything from the board from the six tiles surrounding as well as the tile it is placed on. This includes The Anchor Piece, Towers as well as land tiles. To disarm The Vortex Piece a player's opponent must sacrifice five of his workers within four turns of the initial placement of The Vortex Piece.

112254.name: Forgotten Futures CD-ROM
112254.description:
Introduction
The Forgotten Futures CD-Rom contains all of the Forgotten Futures role playing material plus an expanding collection of Victorian and Edwardian articles, fiction, and illustrations in HTML format.

112255.name: Forgotten Futures Character Generator
112255.description:
Introduction
This program generates characters according to the basic Forgotten Futures rules, based on 21 points and a maximum of three points allocated to any given skill.

Two text fields allow the entry of a character's name and profession. This data will be added to the character record the program produces.

There are various fields for points allocated to characteristics and skills, increased or decreased by clicking on the plus or minus buttons. The total of points remaining, and any bonus points, are shown in the top right boxes. If negative values are shown, more than 21 points have been spent to generate the character.

112256.name: Forgotten Futures Spreadsheet Templates
112256.description:
Introduction
Several of the Forgotten Futures collections include spreadsheet templates which were originally written for use with Lotus 123 Executive. Unfortunately this is now somewhat elderly, and includes a WYSIWYG add-on that is incompatible with many later programs. They have been rewritten for Lotus 123 without the WYSIWYG add-on, Microsoft Excel, and Claris Works for Windows. Most spreadsheets can read one or another of these formats.

Some of the Claris templates are somewhat less "bullet-proof" than the others, since some logical functions that seem to work well in Lotus 123 and Excel gave problems. There are probably ways around this, and I would appreciate comments from anyone who feels able to improve them. The Excel templates seem to work well; however, they mostly require Excel 3 to 5 for correct operation.

Includes Templates for:

Character Records
Blank Records
Currency Conversions
Airship Details
Spaceship Designs
Space Travel Times
Zealand Units
Calendars

112257.name: Pirates 'n Plunder
112257.description:
Pirates 'n Plunder is a game of "Adding/Subtracting Fractions for Fun!"

From Publisher Site:
Using our original Fraction Ladder, players quickly solve fraction problems with addition and subtraction. Then using these answers, they try to build runs of their marbles for bonus points or to block their opponents' runs. If they plunder (surround) an opponent's treasure chest or include a treasure chest in a run, they score extra points. A fun way to practice adding and subtracting fractions with lots of strategy!

There is a wood board version, and a Masonite board version that be used with crayons or water-based overhead markers.

Wooden Version Includes:
- 12" x 12" x 3/4" Birch Game Board
- 80 Glass Marbles (4 colors).
- 4 Marble Trays
- Dice
- Directions
- Game Box

Masonite Version Includes:
- 11" x 11" x 1/8" Masonite Board
- Dice
- Directions

112258.name: Sink the Ship
112258.description:
Sink the Ship is a game of "Multiplying & Dividing Fractions for Fun!"

From Publisher Website:
Multiply or divide two fractions created from the roll of four dice to produce an answer that will help you build runs of your marbles for bonus points or block your opponents' runs. Include a safe port in a run and double your points. Sink the Ship of your opponent in its home port and score even more points. Lots of strategy in this fun game of multiplying and dividing fractions!

There is a wooden board version, and a Masonite wipe-off board version that can be used with crayons or water-based overhead markers.

Wooden Version Includes:
- 12" x 12" x 3/4" Birch Game Board
- 80 Glass Marbles (4 colors).
- 4 Marble Trays
- Dice
- Directions
- Game Box

Masonite Version Includes:
- 11" x 11" x 1/8" Masonite Board
- Dice
- Directions

112260.name: The Third Kingdom: Playtesting Rules
112260.description:
Introduction
The Third Kingdom is a unique and comprehensive fantasy role-playing game. This book contains the all of the rules, options, and background necessary to create a character that will inhabit and interact with this world.

The Third Kingdom is the realm of mortals, bridging
the gap between immortal Faerie and the deathless Eternity.
The world of the Third Kingdom is much like ours in geography
and size, although magic is omnipresent. While standard
fantasy races (elves, dwarves, etc.) exist, the characters are
human.

112262.name: Mortal Konquest
112262.description:
Introduction
Mortal Konquest is an unofficial roleplaying game set in the dark world of Mortal Kombat®. This is not a computer game! It’s a pencil-and-paper, face-to-face RPG for two to six or more players. The complete game rules are on three medium-sized pages, all linked to the index page. We’d really like for anyone who downloads these rules to say something about them to a friend, even if only to say they stink like yesterday’s fish. Watch this space for announcements about unofficial rules supplements, unofficial adventures, and other unofficial stuff involving Mortal Konquest.

So what are you waiting for?

FIGHT!

112263.name: Zombies vs. Robots vs. Ninja vs. Pirates vs. Cowboys: the RPG
rpg: Zombies vs. Robots vs. Ninja vs. Pirates vs. Cowboys: the RPG
112263.description:
Introduction
The game takes place on Adventure Island! (exclamation point required), a largish tropical island far from the trade lanes. Strangely, Adventure Island! doesn’t seem to stay in any particular place for long; sometimes it appears to be in the Caribbean, other times in the South Pacific, and even on occasion in the Indian Ocean. Those who have been there and lived to tell the tale suppose Adventure Island! only appears where and when somebody goes to look for it.

Characters can choose between the five main archetypes. To create a character, use the rules described in the System DL ruleset up until you add skills. Each archetype has five defining skills, and you’ll have 8 points to divide up only among those skills. Then you’ll receive 4 more points to spend on optional skills, or add to your existing skills, as you see fit.

112264.name: MetaHuman DL
112264.description:
User Summary
MetaHuman DL is described as a "a diceless LARP of superhuman proportions." Players generate a character with attributes, skills, and powers that are measured in points. Once characters have been created, a game may be played in a series of rounds whereupon each player selects their action or equipment that they will use in the present round. A referee will pause the game in order to resolve all conflicts.

112267.name: Irides: Master of Blocks
112267.description:
Irides: Master of Blocks is an independently developed, commercially released videogame developed by Madpeet, and the first game by GOAT Store Publishing in 3 years. It is a puzzle game for the Sega Dreamcast and iPhone that combines strategy and action, an easy to pick up and play and hard to master type of puzzler. The game's release date was announced alongside Rush Rush Rally Racing in order to celebrate the 10th Anniversary of the American Dreamcast.

Source: Wikipedia, "Irides: Master of Blocks", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112268.name: Carnaval Festival
112268.description:
The theme is based on the fairground ride "Carnaval Festival" in "De Efteling" (amusement park in holland).

The puppets from Carnaval Festival are hiding out in six places all over the world. For each place there is a cardboardbox that's hiding at least four puppets.

The players have to "ride" around the world searching for matching pairs of puppets, and bringing them back to base before searching for a new pair.

Winner is the player who has found his puppets first and have been able to take them back to his base.

112269.name: Bubble Bobble also featuring Rainbow Islands
112269.description:
Rear of Case

Bubble Bobble and Rainbow Islands, two irresistible arcade classics are back", Crush, burst, blast and blow bubbles, solve mazes and defeat the enemies across 125 levels of mind-boggling, rainbow-rocking gameplay.. because they don't make them like they used to!

112270.name: Pokemon Trading Card Game Online
112270.description:
Free to download, free to play, online version of the Pokémon Trading Card Game!


Guest Mode allows you to get a taste of the excitement in store!



Log in to the game with your free Pokémon Trainer Club account from Pokemon.com to save your progress!



Start playing right away with four free online theme decks!


Source: The Publisher Website.

112271.name: Wir wollen das Sportleistungsabzeichen erwerben!
112271.description:
Objective: be the first to pass the finish line
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
if you land on an area called 'Gefahrenpunkt' = danger point
you made a bad move
introduction is used to motivate children practising sports

112272.description:
Humorous quiz game about Bavaria.
Goa of the game is to reach Munich first. You can advance through luck of the dice, correct answers, real wealth, misleading other players and ignorance of the other players.
Players roll the dice and if arrow is rolled he moves up the ladder. If "K", "S" or "W" is rolled player takes a creative, estimate or knowledge card from the deck and asks a question. There is a short game and a team option.
112272.name: Bayrisches Sammelsurium Das Spiel

112273.description:
Humorous quiz game about Berlin.
Goal of the game is to reach Lehrter station first. You can advance through luck of the dice, correct answers, real wealth, misleading other players and ignorance of the other players.
Players roll the dice and if arrow is rolled he moves up the ladder. If "K", "S" or "W" is rolled player takes a creative, estimate or knowledge card from the deck and asks a question. There is a short game and a team option.
112273.name: Berliner Sammelsurium Das Spiel

112274.name: Der Satzbaumeister
112274.description: There are groups of words On the 48 cards from which players can make sentences. Depending on the difficulty there is one, two or three points to use. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

112275.name: Wizard's Tournament
112275.description:
Wizard's Tournament

Every year, wizards from all over the realm come together to fight over the title of Archmage to become the most powerful wizard in the world. Wizard's Tournament is a fantasy deck building game of magic combat where two players attempt to defeat each other using spells, monsters, and relics. The game comes with thirty-five different sets of cards but only twelve of these card sets are picked at random to be used during a game. These cards are added to a player's deck during a game so every time you play, it will feel like a new and exciting game.

Spell Cards
Spell cards allow a player to perform special actions including dealing damage, drawing cards, healing, and causing an opponent to discard cards. When cast, the ability of a Spell card occurs once and then it is discarded. Fast spells can be played at any time but regular spells can only be cast on the owner's turn. Spell cards can also be discarded to add Spirit to your Spirit Pool.

Monster Cards
Monsters are permanent creatures used to attack your opponent and defend you from enemy monsters. Every monster has a special ability that makes them more dangerous and difficult to defeat.

Relic Cards
These permanent artifacts give a player special abilities that allow them to perform an action every turn until they are destroyed or stolen.

Game Play
Each player starts with thirty Life. If a player reduced his opponent's Life to zero, he wins the game. A player can also win by having thirty or more Spirit in his Spirit Pool or by having one hundred or more Life.

Each player starts the game with ten Spirit cards. Twelve cards are drawn from the Selection deck and these twelve card sets are placed on the table. The starting player is determined randomly. Before play begins, the player that is going first draws one card and the player going second draws three cards.

There are three possible icons on the each card: Green, Blue, and Red.

Green Icons: This is the Cast cost to activate a Spell, Monster, or Relic card. This is also the purchase price in Spirit to add this card to a player's discard pile.

Blue Icons: This is the amount of Spirit added to a player's Spirit Pool when a card with a blue icon is discarded without activating it.

Red Icons: Monster cards have red icons equal to its Power. A monster's Power is equal to a monster's Life and the amount of damage it can deal to a player or another monster.

Turn Sequence - 5 Phases

Draw Phase

A player draws five cards from her deck. A player may never have more than ten cards in her hand at any time. If a player cannot draw a card because her deck has run out of cards, the player must shuffle her discard pile into a new deck.

Purchase Phase

During any phase, Spirit cards or Spell cards can be discarded to add Spirit to a player's Spirit Pool equal to the number in the blue icon on the card. This Spirit can be spent to purchase any of the twelve cards in the center of the table. To add a card to your discard pile, you must pay the value in the card's green icon in Spirit. Only one copy of each card can be purchased each turn.

Magic Phase

Players can spend Spirit to cast Spell, Monster, and Relic cards. When Spell cards are cast, their ability is performed once and then they are discarded. When Monster and Relic cards are cast, they are placed in play with an Activation token. Relics and monsters can use their abilities during the Magic and Combat phases. An Activation token is placed on a relic when it is activated. Relics and monsters with an Activation token cannot be activated.

Combat Phase

A Monster card can be used to attack another player or defend you from an attacking monster. Monsters with an Activation token on them cannot attack, defend, or use their ability. To attack, select all the monsters under your control that you want to attack. Your opponent then decides which of his monsters will defend against each of the attacking monsters. More than one monster can be used to block a single attacking monster. After the attack, place an Activation token on each of the attacking monsters.

If a monster attacks and is not blocked, the defending player’s Life is reduced by the Power of that monster. If a monster is blocked by a defending monster, both monsters deal damage equal to their Power to his opponent. If a monster's damage is ever equal to or greater than its Power, it is destroyed and placed in its owner’s discard pile. If a defending monster cannot absorb all this damage, the excess damage is applied to the defending player. Excess damage applied to an attacking monster is ignored.

If more than one monster is used to block a single attacking monster, the attacking player may apply damage equal to the Power of the attacking monster divided amongst any the defending monsters in any way. Any of these defending monsters that receive enough damage to be destroyed are placed in his owner’s discard pile. If a group of blocking monsters cannot absorb all the damage, the player that controls them has his Life reduced by the excess damage. All the Power of the blocking monsters are combined and applied to the attacking monster. If the damage dealt is equal to or greater than the Power of the attacking monster’s Power, the attacking monster is destroyed and placed in its owner’s discard pile and the excess damage is ignored.

End Phase

All Activation tokens are removed from play, all monster damage is discarded, and all Spirit Pools are emptied.

3 or 4 Player Optional Rules

The game can also be played with optional rules for three or four players when you use the extra Spirit cards included in the game.

Players: 2

Time: 30 Minutes

Ages: 12+

Contents: 292 Cards, Tokens, and a Rule Book

112276.name: Der störrische Esel
112276.description: The donkey carries fruits in a basket towards the market, but a bridge is causing problems. The players have their fruit color, depending on the number of players and different numbers of cards, on the remainder pile. With the card, a player can put a fruit in the basket, repair a broken bridge's step or remove the fruit from another player's basket. With the wild card You have free choice among actions. If the donkey cross the bridge, the player with the most fruits in his basket is the winner.

112279.name: Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – English
112279.description:
Rear of Case

Your children can enter their names/ages and take test to discover their ability for each their age in key subject areas for each title. Certificates can be printed to record progress.

Alternatively, they can use the exciting, game-based learning sections to revise and develop their knowledge - whilst having fun.

The software is full of surprises to maintain their interest and encourages the use of the extensive reference section - whilst actually playing. It's very easy to use and highly compelling.

Topics covered:
• Nouns
• Pronouns
• Adjectives
• Verbs
• Conjunctions
• Prepositions
• Full Stop
• Questions Marks
• Vocabulary
• Commas

112280.name: Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – History
112280.description:
Rear of Case

Your children can enter their names/ages and take test to discover their ability for each their age in key subject areas for each title. Certificates can be printed to record progress.

Alternatively, they can use the exciting, game-based learning sections to revise and develop their knowledge - whilst having fun.

The software is full of surprises to maintain their interest and encourages the use of the extensive reference section - whilst actually playing. It's very easy to use and highly compelling.

Topics covered:
* Ancient Greeks
* Egyptians
* Romans
* Vikings
* Middle Ages
* Aztecs
* Tudors
* Stuarts
* Georgians
* Victorians

112281.name: Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Maths
112281.description:
Rear of Box

Your children can enter their names/ages and take test to discover their ability for each their age in key subject areas for each title. Certificates can be printed to record progress.

Alternatively, they can use the exciting, game-based learning sections to revise and develop their knowledge - whilst having fun.

The software is full of surprises to maintain their interest and encourages the use of the extensive reference section - whilst actually playing. It's very easy to use and highly compelling.

Topics covered:
* Common Fractions
* Measurements
* Decimals
* Percentages
* Addition Problems
* Subtraction Problems
* Shapes & Angles
* Division Problems
* Average & Median
* Simple Algebra

112282.name: Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Mental Maths
112282.description:
Rear of Case

Your children can enter their names/ages and take test to discover their ability for each their age in key subject areas for each title. Certificates can be printed to record progress.

Alternatively, they can use the exciting, game-based learning sections to revise and develop their knowledge - whilst having fun.

The software is full of surprises to maintain their interest and encourages the use of the extensive reference section - whilst actually playing. It's very easy to use and highly compelling.

Topics covered:
* Common Fractions
* Measurements
* Decimals
* Percentages
* Addition
* Subtraction
* Shapes & Angles
* Division
* Average & Median
* Simple Algebra

112283.name: Latrotabuli
112283.description:
This game was created by Jennifer Diane Reitz to make part of her fictional universe of Pastel Defender Heliotrope.

It is based on the ancient game of latrunculi or latrunculorum, where players try to eliminate all the opponent's pieces using a "flanking movement" (i.e. pieces surrounding the captured piece in opposite sides). There's little information about movement of pieces, being suggested different ways.

Latrotabuli is a variant played in 12 x 6 retangular board and players have 12 latros and 1 centurion (acts as king). Latros can move any number of spaces in one of the cardinal directions whilst the Centurion can only move one space.

One particular feature of the game is the possibility of creating several formations to best deployment of pieces: the Testudo and the Phalanx. The testudo is a 4-piece square formation and phalanx is a 4-piece linear formation, in which pieces move as one.

The method of capture depends of the capturing formation (or lack of) and of the captured piece/pieces, and can be by approach, by flanking or by moving and replacing.

There's 3 victory conditions:

capture all opponent latros (pieces)
capture the opponent centurion or,
when a player in the beginning of his turn can't move his centurion, he loses.

112284.name: Danger! Dodgeball
112284.description:
Bring the speed, fun, and the danger of no-rules Dodgeball to the flick of your wrist.

* Dodge curveballs, slow bombs, and sinister doppelgangers
* Attack with head-pegging red rubber balls
* Easy-to-learn, insane-to-master accelerometer controls

Source: The Developer Website.

112285.name: Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Science
112285.description:
Rear of Case

Your children can enter their names/ages and take test to discover their ability for each their age in key subject areas for each title. Certificates can be printed to record progress.

Alternatively, they can use the exciting, game-based learning sections to revise and develop their knowledge - whilst having fun.

The software is full of surprises to maintain their interest and encourages the use of the extensive reference section - whilst actually playing. It's very easy to use and highly compelling.

Topics covered:
* Scientific Equipments
* Life Processes
* Environment
* Solar Systems
* Humans as Organisms
* Materials
* Plants as Organisms
* Forces & Motion
* Electricity
* Light & Sound

112286.name: Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Spelling
112286.description:
Rear of Case

Your children can enter their names/ages and take test to discover their ability for each their age in key subject areas for each title. Certificates can be printed to record progress.

Alternatively, they can use the exciting, game-based learning sections to revise and develop their knowledge - whilst having fun.

The software is full of surprises to maintain their interest and encourages the use of the extensive reference section - whilst actually playing. It's very easy to use and highly compelling.

Topics covered:
* 3 Letter Words
* 4 Letter Words
* Days & Dates
* Useful Words
* Silent Letters
* Plurals
* Animals & Birds
* More Useful Words
* Prefixes & Surfixes
* Difficult Endings & Words

videogame: Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – English
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – History
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Maths
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Mental Maths
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Science
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Spelling
112287.name: SATS Learning
videogamecompilation: Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – English
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – History
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Maths
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Mental Maths
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Science
Action SATS Learning: Key Stage 2 – Spelling
112287.description:
Rear of Case

Your children can enter their names/ages and take test to discover their ability for each their age in key subject areas for each title. Certificates can be printed to record progress.

Alternatively, they can use the exciting, game-based learning sections to revise and develop their knowledge - whilst having fun.

The software is full of surprises to maintain their interest and encourages the use of the extensive reference section - whilst actually playing. It's very easy to use and highly compelling.

Topics covered:
* Spelling
* Science
* Maths
* Mental Maths
* History
* English

112289.name: The Times Ace Monkey: Key Stage 1 – English
112289.description:
Rear of Case

The Times Educational Series is designed by a panel of UK education experts and award-winning teachers to give children a head start with education.

With these brilliantly designed multimedia CD ROMs your children will enjoy themselves so much that they will be learning before they know it.

Each CD ROM has a Parent Only Area where you can keep track of your child's progress and learn how to get most out of Ace Monkey.

Topics Covered:
* Reading
* Writing & Spelling
* Phonics
* Vowels & Consonants
* Verbs, Nouns & Adjectives
* Rhyming Words

112290.name: The Times Ace Monkey: Key Stage 1 – Maths
112290.description:
Rear of Case

The Times Educational Series is designed by a panel of UK education experts and award-winning teachers to give children a head start with education.

With these brilliantly designed multimedia CD ROMs your children will enjoy themselves so much that they will be learning before they know it.

Each CD ROM has a Parent Only Area where you can keep track of your child's progress and learn how to get most out of Ace Monkey.

Topics Covered:
* Counting & Sequencing Numbers
* Missing Numbers, Number Pasterns & Number Pairs
* Odd & Even Numbers
* Greater Than & Less Than
* Addition, Subtraction & Fractions
* 2D & 3D Shapes

112291.name: Handelsschiffe auf den Weltmeeren
112291.description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible by transporting goods by boat
- moving by turns -
each players chooses a coloured meeple and draws 4 cards
the 4 cards represent goods he has to deliver to the listed port
due to his meeple each player follows his coloured route
by rolling the dice
delivering goods the player draws a new cargo card (only the first player entering same port may draw a cargo card)
game ends if alls player have reached their final destination port (first one gets special bonus)
player with highest bonus points wins

112292.name: The Times Ace Monkey: Key Stage 1 – Science
112292.description:
Rear of Case

The Times Educational Series is designed by a panel of UK education experts and award-winning teachers to give children a head start with education.

With these brilliantly designed multimedia CD ROMs your children will enjoy themselves so much that they will be learning before they know it.

Each CD ROM has a Parent Only Area where you can keep track of your child's progress and learn how to get most out of Ace Monkey.

Topics Covered:
* Interactive Map of Ace Money's body
* Detailed activities on different body parts
* Exercise
* Healthy Eating
* Sleep
* Keeping Clean

112293.description:
Toads&Dragonflies is a tile laying game that is a directly descendant to Hippos & Crocodiles of nestorgames . Its development was sparked by the contest Nestorgames is constantly holding on BGG for new games. And each abstract deserves a hexed version...:)
You place your animals on the board, whoever can't place his tile looses.

Included in this game are 3 board sizes. The river, the lake and the stream.The later needs 4 tiles, called "boulders" to be placed before choosing your animal.
112293.name: Toads & Dragonflies

112294.name: Deutschlands Klügste
112294.description:
Quiz based on TV Show.
In Round 1 will be asked 12 questions and 4 possible answers given to each player for his answers.
In Round 2, each player chooses a category and then try to answer within the specified time as many questions as he can. The results obtained in Round 1 and 2 points determine the participants for the final. Who has the most points after that is the winner.

112295.name: The Lord of the Rings Online: Siege of Mirkwood
videogameseries: The Lord of the Rings Online
videogameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar
112295.description:
The Lord of the Rings Online: Siege of Mirkwood is the second retail expansion pack for the MMORPG The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar and was released on December 1, 2009 in North America and December 3, 2009 in Europe. Unlike the first expansion this edition was only available via a web based download.

The expansion added the southern region of Mirkwood. The game's level cap has been increased to level 65, and the expansion included the conclusion to Volume II of the epic storyline. It also introduced a new "skirmish" system that allows for repeatable, randomised and scalable combat based instances that can be accessed from anywhere in the game world for 1, 3, 6 and 12 players and new 3, 6 and 12 player private instances that take place in Dol Guldur proper.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Lord of the Rings Online: Siege of Mirkwood", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112296.name: The 7 Dwarfs
112296.description:
"The 7 Dwarfs" in english.
The dwarves are numbered and must be combined to form families, which may be the sum not higher than 7. Players score points for entire families. The player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

112297.name: The Lord of the Rings Online: Rise of Isengard
videogameseries: The Lord of the Rings Online
videogameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar
112297.description:
The Lord of the Rings Online: Rise of Isengard is the latest expansion pack for the MMORPG The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar, released on September 27, 2011. This is the third expansion pack for The Lord Of The Rings Online and, like the previous expansion, it is available a web-based download only.

The Rise of Isengard officially brings the game's timeline to the events of The Two Towers. Players accompany the Grey Company as they ride to the aid of Aragorn, traveling through the new areas of Dunland, The Gap of Rohan, and the legendary region of Isengard, seat of Saruman the White. New game enhancements include a level cap increase to 75, level 75 legendary items, a new crafting tier, a 24-man raid, stat cap removal and improved virtue traits. There were also several major class revisions; the minstrel and the champion classes, in particular. The Epic Story was update with Volume 3 Book 4: The Rise of Isengard and introduced such iconic characters as Grimbold, Théodred, Grima Wormtongue and Saruman the White.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Lord of the Rings Online: Rise of Isengard", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112298.name: Bedlam
112298.description:
User Summary

Bedlam is a top-down shooter. The player (or players) battle wave after wave of alien ships, dodging fire and attacking ground targets if possible.

The game includes 17 stages and can be played insingle player, hotseat or coop mode (in coop mode the players' ships bounce off each other). Each wave of enemy ships is designed to have a weakness which allow a cunning player to destroy it without risk. If an entire wave is destroyed, the player gains a temporary invincibility power-up. Power-ups (invincibility shields and extra lives) can also be found by destroying ground structures.

112299.name: Ninja Commando
112299.description:
User Summary

Ninja Commando is a horizontal scrolling platform game by Zeppelin Games. The player must lead a ninja to the end of each of the 8 levels of the game by jumping on platforms and structures. The ninja is unarmed and can only destroy enemy by jumping on them.

112300.name: Reckless Getaway
112300.description:
Escape with your hard-earned loot and the cops hot at your heels!
Who’d a thought robbing the bank would be the easy part?
Now comes the real challenge - to escape with your hard-earned loot and the fuzz hot at your heels!
Weave in and out of oncoming traffic; dodge, outrun or ram pursuing police cars and just generally crash, smash and thrash your way through 16 varied levels.
Let’s face it: beating someone across the finishing line is a lot of fun, but not nearly as much fun as tackling them into oncoming traffic to watch chaos ensue
The Developers behind Reckless Racing now brings you Reckless Getaway!

Source: The Developer Website.

112301.name: Para Academy
112301.description:
User Summary

A budget "military training" game by Zeppelin game. The player must complete six tests: sprinting, swimming, tug-of-war, weightlifting, shooting and climbing. Success in each category give points. Once a series of six tests is passed, another series of six tests begins, with higher difficulty. The goal of the game is to earn the most points in order to reach the "Red Beret" rank.

Each of the tests is a simple "move the joystick right and left as fast as you can" type, only the shooting test is different (it's shooting gallery, with only one bullet per target).

112302.name: Para Assault Course
112302.description:
User Summary

A combat training simulator game. The game include an obstacle course, parallel bars, barbed wire crossing, tunnel crawling and rope climbing. Most of the gameplay involves wiggling the joystick left and right and pressing the fire button at the right moment.

112303.name: Q10 Tank Buster
112303.description:
User Summary

Q10 Tank Buster is a side-scrolling shoot'em up. As a pilot of the Q10 ground attack aircraft (obviously inspired by the american A10 aircraft), you must destroy wave after wave of enemy tanks, planes and ground installations.

Power-ups can be collected that give escort planes (smaller aircraft on the top or bottom of the player plane that provide additional firepower). Each game stage ends with a boss fight.

112304.name: F1 Tornado Simulator
112304.description:
User Summary

F1 Tornado Simulator is a side-scrolling shooter. The player's plane (an F1 Tornado aircraft) takes off from an aircraft carrier and must battle through wave after wave of enemy ground and air forces to complete each stage.

Power-ups can be picked up to gain additional weapons or a defensive shield. Each stage ends with a boss fight.

112305.name: Saigon Combat Unit
112305.description:
User Summary

Saigon Combat Unit is a side-scrolling run and gun budget game set in the Vietnam war. The player controls a soldier whose goal is to reach the end of the level to complete his mission. The player must shoot enemies, jump platforms and avoid traps. The game is split in two parts, which the player chooses when the game loads.

112306.name: Sword Of The Samurai
112306.description:
User Summary

A gang of renegade ninjas has kidnapped hostages and threaten to kill them. The Samurai's mission is to rescue the hostages and kill anyone that would stand in the way.

Sword of the Samurai is a clone of Shinobi, with the same gameplay (side scrolling, jump on platforms, shoot enemies with shurikens, pick up hostages). The game includes 9 levels.

112307.name: inFAMOUS: Festival of Blood
112307.description:
User Summary

A standalone DLC game set against the backdrop of inFAMOUS 2. Cole is up against "Bloody Mary", a vampire queen. Cole gains vampire powers and uses them to take on the vampire cult he finds.

112308.name: The Duct
112308.description:
User Summary

A "tube shooter" inspired by Tempest. The player drives a buggy down a duct, dodging obstacles or blasting them with a laser. The buggy can move left, right or jump. The player must also collect energy and fuel capsules in order to keep going (the game ends when either energy or fuel runs out).

112309.name: World Soccer
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition
English/European Atari ST 3.5" disk (EDOS re-release) edition
English/European Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk (EDOS re-release) edition
English/European ZX Spectrum Cassette (EDOS re-release) edition
112309.description:
User Summary

A soccer team management game. The player creates a team and must manage it correctly in order to win the World Soccer Competition: choosing the right player for each position in the team, buying and selling players, knowing the weaknesses of the other teams... The game is driven by a point-and-click interface.

112311.name: Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts / Viva Piñata
112311.description:
User Summary

This is a compilation of Banjo-kazooie: Nuts & Bolts & Viva Piñata. This bundle was released in US, packaged with the Xbox 360 Arcade system. The promotional bundle was available in the Spring in 2010.

112312.name: Zombie Mosh 2.5
112312.description:
Zombie Mosh puts you in the role of a human survivor or the walking undead in a table top environment, using your scenery and miniatures. It takes place during modern times.

Game-play consists of the sides (survivors and zombies) taking turns with move, shoot and melee phases. The game uses 6 sided dice for all outcomes. There are rules for over 30 different weapons to kill the zombies with and rules for vehicle movement and running down zombies with. There are also several scenarios to use which include maps and modifying suggestions to make each scenario more replayable. Each scenario has different goals and set ups. With these rules it would be easy to play out any scene from any of your favorite zombie movies. There are also all of the markers and templates needed to play included.

Everything is in full color. It is available in pdf format at this time and has 56 pages. Was originally written in 2007, 2.0 was released in 2008 and 2.5 was released in 2011. There is a rumor of a 3.0 release.

112313.name: Four Second Firestorm
112313.description:
User Summary

The third of the Four Second games. This one features 175 games that must be completed in four seconds or less. 56 developers collaborated on the project. There are several modes of play.
In Original you play twenty games, and have seven lives to get through them all.
In Endurance mode you play fifty games, and have ten lives.
In Sudden Death you play fifty games, with just one life.
In A Single Game you can play the same mini game as often as you like, and play whichever of the games you like.

112314.name: Faial
112314.description:
User Summary

Faial is a simple RPG modelled after choose your own adventure gamebooks. The player leads the hero, a young knight eager for adventure, who soon finds himself unwittingly part of a sorcerer's plot.

The game starts with character creation. The character's abilities are randomised and are used to compute skill values (like climbing or dodging). Once a character is created, the game plays like a gamebook: the player picks a choice among several, the game describes the consequences, then the player picks a choice, and so on. Combat is automatic, and can only result in death for either the character or the opponent(s).

112315.name: Hey Wizard
112315.description:
User Summary

One day you open a mysterious book and release the Megagate. The Megagate then steals most of your spells! The only way you can get them back is to destroy the Megagate and it's minions. You start with three spells, lightning, fire and the necroclaw. Each can be upgradged, and have a number of uses.
Lightning can be used to propel yourself upward, and can be charged. It has a larger range than fire. Fire is of limited range, but can be used continuously. It can also be used as a jetpack to propel yourself upward. The necrohand can grab enemies, or be used as a platform or to block enemies.

112316.name: Hey Wizard: Quest for the Magic Mojo
112316.description:
User Summary

The King of Mojo is missing, and only you can help! You must find the mojo statues. This game features achievements, and the spells are somewhat different than the first game. Your spell meter to begin with gives much more magic, enemies reveal damage in HP when hit, and your flame and lightning have far more transportation effect when used.

112317.name: Top Gun: Combat Zones
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112317.description:
User Summary

Top Gun: Combat Zones is an action flight game where the player begins as a trainee at the Top Gun school and then advances to combat missions. The aircraft simulated in the game are real-life U.S. Navy platforms such as the F-14 Tomcat and the F/A-18 Hornet. The action is not strictly a flight simulator, but it tends to be a little more involved and technically sound than the average arcade jet game.

112318.name: Hostile Skies
112318.description:
User Summary

You control a biplane in WWI, try to shoot down enemy planes, and bomb their ships, and avoid being shot. You must also land your plane after missions.

112321.name: Hobo
112321.description:
User Summary

You are a hobo, sleeping at a city dump when a police officer attacks you. You decide to extract revenge on any and all people you see. Unlock combos as you play, such as spitting, hawking loogies, and burping at people.
Cartoon graphics, and very irreverent and disgusting gameplay.

112322.name: Hobo Prison Brawl
112322.description:
User Summary

Continues the story of the hobo. This time you are awoken by your prison cellmate, who is upset at the state of your shared toilet. You don't take kindly to this, and a brawl breaks out where you take on any and all comers. Cartoon graphics and disgusting unlockable combos await. Many combos from the first game you have unlocked from the beginning.

112323.name: Hobo 3: Wanted
112323.description:
User Summary

Continues the story of the Hobo. After escaping prison, he is wanted dead or alive. A police officer wakes him up while sleeping on a garbage can. Our hobo does not take kindly to this and begins another rampage. Many disgusting combos from the first two games begin unlocked. Cartoon graphics and an irreverent tone await.

112324.name: Hobo 4: Total War
112324.description:
User Summary

A few days after the events of Hobo 3, the army is now after our hobo. Waking him up while sleeping under a tree was a tactical error, and now the mayhem begins. You start with a large number of disgusting combos from the earlier games. The game features cartoon graphics and an irreverent style.

112325.name: Battleship (2009)
112325.description:
User summary
