Based on the Battleship boardgame. Players fire into a 10x10 grid of open ocean in hopes of hitting an enemy vessel.

Version has three games modes: Classic, Salvo and Super Weapons.

112326.name: Hobo 5: Space Brawls – Attack of the Hobo Clones
112326.description:
User Summary

This game begins shortly after Hobo 4. In this game aliens have abducted our hobo, and awaken him by stealing all his combos! You begin with none of them, and must fight to unlock them all. Cartoon graphics and irreverent tone await.

112327.name: HeliStorm
112327.description:
User Summary

A helicopter war game. You want to rescue your troops, and of course destroy as many enemy ships as you can. Rescue troops, fire your guns or missiles, use your shields, and don't run out of fuel.

112328.name: HeliStorm Episode 2: Re-Group
112328.description:
User Summary

Very similar to HeliStorm, but this game gives a new objective which is to protect a convoy of trucks, and destroy enemy artillery. You will control a helicopter with guns, missiles, and a shield. Once again, watch your shield and fuel meters carefully.

112329.name: Mandragore
112329.description:
User Summary

Everything was fine in the prosperous lands of Mandragore, until one fateful night, a rain of shooting stars fell on the country, one of the killing king Joriand. A lord named Yarod-Nor appeared and assumed power, imposing his reign of tyranny upon the land and its inhabitants. Your party of adventurers must find a way to defeat Yarod-Nor and return peace to the realm. In order to succeed, you must first explore the nine castles and find out what happened there. Then, armed with your new-found knowledge and experience, you'll be able to enter Yarod-Nor's castle and confront him.

Mandragore is one of the first French computer RPGs. It is party-based (four adventurers). The player can use a pre-generated party or create characters. The game rules are heavily inspired by Dungeons & Dragons: possible character races are elf, hal-orc, dwarf, human and hobbit, character classes include warrior, ranger, thief, wizard, bard and sage. Characters are defined by 6 abilities, and grow stronger as they gain levels.

The game features a map of the realm of Mandragore where the player moves the party. Once the party enters a town or dungeon, the view changes to a pseudo-3d display of the surroundings. Interaction with monsters, NPC and items and combat is done by typing orders, using a shorthand system to minimise the number of keystrokes. The game also includes a savegame feature.

112330.name: Crônicas da Sétima Lua Cenário de Campanha
112330.description:
Chronicles from the Seventh Moon is a Brazilian fantasy roleplaying game setting for the D&D 3.X system.

From the back cover:

GET READY FOR THE ADVENTURE OF YOUR LIFE!

CHRONICLES OF THE 7th MOON brings you a stunning new world of fantasy!

An entity of immense power - known as "Annihilation" - came to the material plane to devour the world of Elaria and the whole creation. Unable to defeat it, the gods decided to trap it in your own world, using a powerful ritual to create a seal with the moons to bind to, the Seal of the Six Moons!

Saved from the destruction by the gods, entire races and civilizations from Elaria were taken to the last moon, Isaldar, the Seventh Moon, once the home of the orcs and a long-lost civilization.

But the gods have paid a heavy price to imprison the Annihilation: their own lives! All the gods have died ... Their deaths have affected dramatically the Seventh Moon: their bodies fell in the heart of the continent in a great cataclysm!

The fall of the Gods forever changed the world of Isaldar. This upheaval has created a vast unearthly desert in the middle of the Aldar continent, called "The Wound", where the echoes of the divine tragedy become real threats, and brought about a mysterious element – the Divine Metal - which made the blend of magic and technology possible. But the greatest legacy left by the gods were the Luminaries ...

Individuals who carry a small spark of the gods powers, the Luminaries are capable of amazing feats, and only they can ascend to become the new gods! And Isaldar need new gods ...

At each new planetary alignment, when all the seven moons align with Elaria, the power of the Seal of the Six Moons of the Seal weakens and the power of Annihilation is felt at the Seventh Moon. The rise of new gods are needed so they can face the entity body when it is finally free, which may occur in the next alignment ...

Discover a new world to explore and face challenges never before seen, as the terrifying Darkness! Soar the skies aboard the magnificent air ships created by Techno magic and uncover the divine secrets buried deep in the Wound!

Be a Luminary and face your destiny!

Inside this book you will find:

- The Divine Spark: the fantastic powers of the Luminaries, who can become gods.
- Action Points: a heroic deed system for characters who are not Luminaries.
- The Divine Metal: a new special material with eldritch properties, the base element for the Techno magic.
- Techno magic: a new way to weave magic blended with technology.
- Races: a new approach on the basic core races plus a new one.
- Classes and Prestige Classes: a new approach to the core classes, a new class and four new prestige classes.
- Feats and Magic: ten new Feats, a new Domain and new spells.
- Monsters: five new monsters.

112331.name: Crônicas da Sétima Lua Guia de Isaldar
112331.description:
Chronicles from the Seventh Moon is a Brazilian fantasy roleplaying game setting for the D&D 3.X system.

From the back cover:

"The Adventure of Your Life is Just Beginning!

Chronicles from the 7th Moon brings a new and awesome fantasy world where your character can even become a god!

CHRONICLES OF THE 7th MOON offers you a new and stunning fantasy world where your character can become a god!

CHRONICLES OF THE 7th MOON - GUIDE TO ISALDAR complements the first book of the setting, detailing each region and providing more information of the environment for players and DMs, and new options for characters.

Discover a new world to explore and face challenges never before seen! Soar the skies aboard the magnificent air ships created by Technomagic and unravel the divine secrets buried deep in the Wound! Meet the monsters of darkness that comes from the Underground to waste the surface kingdoms! Take the path of the Luminary and dare to desire to become a god, before a new cosmic Alignment release the Annihilation and the whole creation is destroyed!

CHRONICLES OF THE 7th MOON - GUIDE TO ISALDAR brings more information about this fascinating new world.

Is this book you are going to find:

- Detailed descriptions about the people and kingdoms of the 7th Moon.
- 3 new Prestige Classes.
- 28 new Feats.
- A new playable Race - the Half-Dragons.
- Several NPC with detailed information and background.

and a lot more!

112333.name: Réia Cenário de Campanha
112333.description:
Réia is a brasilian campaign setting for the D&D 3.X system. Set in an alternative Charles Magno's Europa filled with elves, dwarves, orcs, dragons and magic.

From the back cover:

"Defend the Empire

Réia, Campaign Setting brings an epic world of Knighthood and Magic!

Inspired on the medieval songs and knight's tales, Réia is a free recreation of the Charles Magno Empire set in a fantasy world for the D20 System. A version of Europa of the year 800 with dwarves, elves, orcs, magic... and Dragon!

The players take the roles of brave knights and nobles adventures in service of the Holy Empire and his Emperor, Carlomano. Those who quest for the utter honor a mortal could have: become one of the "Carlomano's Champions". The Champions are the most legendary heroes of all Réia and their deeds are sung all across the Eurone and beyond!

Threatened by the Orc Horde, by the Caliphate and by the often raids from the barbarians northmen, it's up to the heroes to protect the Holy Empire in the darkest age of the world, with their wits, martial and magic skills.

Magic... In a world where to have such power can be seen both as a gift as a curse, is the driven force capable to change the outcome of battles and shape the fate of the entire mankind!"

112334.name: Roland On The Run
112334.description:
User Summary

A clone of Frogger for Amstrad machines. Roland and his friends have hitched a ride aboard a freight train. Now they must jump out of the train and try to reach the other side of the road by jumping on trucks and cars.

112335.description:
This game is a re-themeing of Dominion; a collaborative title of Dominion and Nitro+. Featuring new illustrations by the original artists from Nitro+, the game plays exactly the same as Dominion: each player construct their own deck from a common pool of available cards, and the person with the most victory point wins at the end.

Features 491 cards, consisting of titles from all Nitro+ games.

Nitro+ titles:
Phantom PHANTOM OF INFERNO, VAMPIRDZHIJA VJEDOGONIA, Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer, "Hello, world.", Demonbane, Saya no Uta, Angelos Armas, Jingai Makyo, Hanachirasu, Dra+KoI, Kishinhishou Demonbane, Gekko no Carnevale, TRE DONNE CRUDELI, Sumaga, CHAOS;HEAD, Sumaga Special, FullMetalDaemon MURAMASA, FullMetalDaemon MURAMASA Janen Arc, STEINS;GATE, AXANAEL, SoniComi

Together with guest titles of:
BLASSREITER
Fate/Zero
Guilty Crown
112335.name: Nitroplus Card Masters

112336.name: Mission Genocide
112336.description:
User Summary

A budget top-down shoot'em up by programmed by Paul Shirley. Fight wave after wave of enemies and bomb ground targets for points and power-ups.

The game was praised for its smooth and fast scrolling (which was better than a lot of full-priced games according to a lot of reviewers).

112337.name: Phantasy Star Online: Episode I & II
videogamehonor: 2001–2002 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
2003 Golden Joystick Best Online Game of the Year Nominee
112337.description:
Game Box

The planet Ragol is once again in peril. New character classes and weapons are at your disposal, but only your skills as a Hunter will keep you alive. Brave the depths of evil alone or enlist the aid of three Heroes in split-screen play. Once you have conquered the Darkness, go online and take your experience to the next level. However you choose to play, know this: Evil has returned to Ragol, and a new adventure awaits.

112339.name: Cook Wars
112339.description:
User Summary

Cook Wars is a party game where players compete in over 30 mini-games in the kitchen. They can create delicious meals from 5 different countries, and game modes include 2 vs. 2, 3 vs. 1, or free for all.

112340.name: Jewel Master: Cradle of Rome
112340.description:
Welcome to the Ancient Rome of more than 2,000 years ago! Your task is nothing less than to create the most legendary city the world has ever seen from a small village and to succeed Caesar in a fantastic puzzle adventure!

Touch two adjacent squares to swap them around and create a row of three or more of the same treasures. Before you know it, you’ll have built up massive chains! Collect jewels and other precious objects and watch how the money from these continues to expand your city.

Combine secret bonus tools to achieve your goals more quickly, but watch out for the traps. Perhaps after the next level you’ll already be in a position to build the Colosseum?

FEATURES:

100 fantastic new levels
20 historical sites from 5 eras to build
A top class match 3 game!
Great bonus features

Source: The Publisher Website.

112341.name: Cranium Kabookii
112341.description:
Cranium Kabookii

A video game version available on the Wii platform. Activities comprise a mixture of some from the original game and new games better suited for a video game environment.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cranium (board game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112342.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 3 No 1 - Spring 2039)
112342.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Return Fire, 10 O'clock, New Officers, New Business Openings, In the Arena, On the Road, Classifieds, Duel Slang, The Showroom, Murphy's Corner, Local Hero, Nuts and Bolts, & Closing Fire.

112343.name: Crayola: Colorful Journey
112343.description:
The game makes use of advanced physics technology, and allows the player to draw and color-in new parts of the levels, to help the boy and his dog navigate their way to safety.

Source: The Developer Website.

112344.name: Shin Chan: The New Aventures for Wii
112344.description:
Crayon Shin-chan: Saikyou Kazoku Kasukabe King Wii is a videogame developed and published for the Wii based upon the manga and anime series Crayon Shin-chan. The game was launched on April 2008 in Spain with the title "Shin Chan: Las Nuevas Aventuras para Wii" (Shin Chan: The New Aventures for Wii). This game was a launch title for the Wii in Japan and Spain only.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crayon Shin-chan: Saikyou Kazoku Kasukabe King Wii", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112345.name: Crazy Chicken Tales
112345.description:
Prepare for the wildest ride of your life! Join Moorhuhn and his friends on their greatest adventure yet- searching for the Forsaken Castle of lore. Face deadly traps and cunning fiends as you jump, run and ride on the backs of Moorhuhn's friends through colorful landscapes of mysterious woods, rocky mountain ranges, treacherous plains and gloomy dungeons.

Crazy Chicken's thrilling debut on Wii™
Play as Moorhuhn, Kroet, Moorfrog, and Rambock
Singleplayer Campaign Mode & Multiplayer Racing Mode
More than 12 different opponents to overcome or evade
Two handy weapons for every occasion
Challenging piggy-back rides take you across mountains and streams
Hilarious Jump 'n Run fun for the whole family

Source: The Publisher Website.

112346.name: Crazy Climber Wii
112346.description:
User Summary

Crazy Climber is a 3D update of the 1980s arcade game of the same name. Players race up buildings, avoiding obstacles and enemies as they climb.

112347.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 3 No 2 - Summer 2039)
112347.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Milestones, New Businesses, 10 O'clock News, In the Arena, On the Road, Classifieds, Duel Slang, The Showroom, Murphy's Corner, Local Hero, Nuts and Bolts, & Closing Fire.

112348.name: Crazy Machines
112348.description:
In the game, players build imaginative machines that turn cranks, rotate gears, pull levers, and more to build a unique contraption. The player can solve more than 200 challenging puzzles and experiment with gears, robots, explosives, and more in a virtual lab. The game uses a physics engine to simulate various in-game variables such as air pressure, electricity, gravity, and particle effects.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crazy Machines", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112349.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 3 No 3 - Fall 2039)
112349.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Milestones, Return Fire, Ten Best, 10 O'clock News, In the Arena, On the Road, Classifieds, Duel Slang, The Showroom, Local Hero, On the Soapbox, & Closing Fire.

112350.name: Crazy Mini Golf 2
112350.description:
Kidz Sports: Crazy Mini Golf 2, Developed by Data Design Interactive will be exclusively for the Wii and will support the new MotionPlus Controller for the most realistic and accurate putting movement. Totally fluid instant feedback, wherever you swing your putter, your on-screen character follows; lift, turn, twist, swing, every detailed swing of your putter is accurately replicated in real time. It works for both left and right handed players.

Hot on the heels of the original, Crazy Mini Golf 2 is a larger-than-life, party game that mimics the action and excitement of this popular sport.

Become fully immersed in the atmosphere of each environment with vibrant visual effects and awe-inspiring locations. With 72 of the craziest holes spread over four different worlds, ranging from the spooky Halloween World, the ancient ruins of Egypt, the excitement of the Fun Fair and the cool Ice Age, you’ll have hours of fun putting your way around each course.

Using the new Wii MotionPlus controller, Crazy Mini Golf 2 presents a realism that has until now not been possible, this is the most realistic and fluid golfing experience available anywhere. The intuitive controls will make a great game for beginners and a fun challenge for the more experienced player, providing a rich, newly designed, casual golf game that revolutionises the way video game golf is played. Crazy Mini Golf 2 ‘putts’ the player in total control of the club!

Create your own unique avatars to play in game using the ‘NuYu’ character editor.
There is no limit to the amount of crazy characters you can create, with buckets of customizable features ranging from hairstyles, clothing, hats, glasses and much, much more!

Develop your career as a pro or challenge your friends in the Multiplayer mode featuring game play designed specifically to get players together for a fun experience. You can also play to beat your previous records or the current champions. The more skilled a golfer you become, the more challenge there is to keep beating your old records!

Feel the unmatched fun and intensity of the game with intuitive game play. Bringing you a fun, active and easy to play experience that family and friends can enjoy in the comfort of their own living room!

Key Features:

72 larger-than-life holes with bright colourful interactive levels
Four exciting new courses including Funfair, Ice Age, Halloween and Egyptian Pyramids.
Engage in single player or multiplayer tournaments to see who is the ultimate crazy golf champion? (up to 4 Wii Remotes at once)
Special focus on the competitive Multi-Player experience. Play with up to 4 friends or family.
Single-Player Tournament Mode – Hone your skills in the single player challenge.
Fully immersive Wii Motion Plus technology turns the Wii Remote controller into a virtual putter.
Intuitive and incredibly easy to pick-up-and-play control design that brings the game to life like never before for both casual and more advanced players.
Create and customise your own unique golfing character with the amazing NuYu editor, compatible with NuYu’s from Crazy mini golf 1.
Successful play allows for the unlocking of new character costumes, and courses.
On-screen information describes the control method in a simple way for players of all ages.
Immersive stylized graphic environments and characters with sound that enhances the game play experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

112351.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 3 No 4 - Winter 2039)
112351.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Murphy's Corner, Milestones, 10 O'clock News, Game News, In the Arena, On the Road, Duel Slang, The Showroom, Local Hero, Metal Duellist, & Closing Fire.

112352.name: Jump the Shark: A Storytelling Gambling Game
112352.description:
Have you ever watched a bad movie and said to yourself, "I could write better than that!" Well, here's your chance!

In Jump the Shark you and your friends are trapped screenwriters who are forced to write bad movies. Even in your poor circumstances, though, you make a gambling game of your situation, so you get the dual fun of making up a great/horrible story and rolling dice. Risk a token for each addition to the scene. Only the last writer and the caller have a shot at the pot. Win the most tokens, and you win the game!

112353.name: "Battle of Britain" Game
112353.description:
Air battle game for 2 players played on a hex grid. Both players receive 12 planes and the game ends when one player has lost all planes.

The game is played on a board which is a side view of sky. Planes move d6 hexes and can shoot down enemy planes if they stop exactly behind or above the enemy plane. The first move is always straight and maximum of three planes can be moved in one turn, all planes move the same number of hexes.

112354.description:
This promo includes seven "Mystery Box" cards and was only available through Kickstarter during the project to fund the "White Elephant" card game.

Mystery Box Rules


Deal Gift Cards to each player according to the rules in the standard game, then deal one Mystery Box card to each player. Players keep this card until their turn to be the starting player.
Each player simultaneously places one Gift Card from their hand face-down in the center of the table as in the standard game. The starting player (the player who will select the first gift of this party) places his or her Mystery Box card face up on top of their own Gift Card. This gift is now the "Mystery Box" gift for this round.
The game continues as normal with the exception that when a player selects the Mystery Box gift they do not “open” it by turning it over. The gift may be selected and stolen like any other gift without being revealed.
When the round is over and each player has a gift, the player with the Mystery Box gift may now look at the Gift Card without revealing it to the other players. The player, the only one who knows the color and number of that card, tucks it face-down under his or her Gift List Card. The Mystery Box card used this round may now be discarded.
The next round resumes with the new starting player using his or her Mystery Box card.


Rules Updates (12/09/2011)

When played as written in the current rules, the Mystery Boxes usually didn't hold very good presents. Therefore, the designer (Brian Kelley) suggests that you follow the current rules, except for these changes:


Before looking at their cards players randomly select one of the cards dealt to them to be their Mystery Box gift, keeping it face down.
Players place their Mystery Box card on top of this selected card without looking at it.
The Mystery Boxes are then kept close to each player until it is their turn to select a gift first, and then they are the ones who bring the Mystery Box to the "party."
112354.name: White Elephant: Mystery Box Promo Cards

112355.name: Toc Toc Woodman: Golden Axe Expansion
112355.description: The Golden Axe Expansion comes as a result of several testers saying they wished the game had two axes, it makes playing the game that much quicker, and it also gives you the opportunity for options on your turn. Some of the variants with the Golden Axe include opting to use the Golden Axe for only ONE hit rather than the normal TWO on your turn, but if you do get anything to fall you get double the points! This can help you catch up if you're behind... or kill you if you aren't careful.

112356.name: Toc Toc Woodman: Golden Core and Bark Promo
112356.description: This is a special colored core and bark set that can be used to add many variations to the game, it includes the golden core and four golden bark pieces. The suggested rules are posted here on BGG. This is GREAT for adding even more strategy to the game! You can put all of the GOLDEN BARK in one section or spread it out over the tree as you prefer. Each GOLDEN BARK is worth double points but beware of the Golden Core, it is twice as bad at -10 points! You do NOT want to hit the Golden Core off!

112357.name: Starzone
112357.description:
Starzone is a print-and-play game for 2 players set in outer space. Each player battles with a fleet of spacecraft by flicking coins into the Starzone target. The Starzone target is made up of different zones, and asteroids which litter space. Which zone you hit determines which action you take: you can repair your spacecraft, activate your shields, add or destroy asteroids on the target, or damage your opponent's spacecraft. A special Zone Shift zone on the target allows you to change which actions can be activated by hitting each zone, adding a tactical element to the game. Your spacecraft has different sectors, and the health of each sector is given by hit points. When one sector is destroyed then your spacecraft is destroyed. The first player to destroy three of their enemy's fleet wins the game.

Starzone is a fun and furious game of dexterity and strategy. Outwit your opponent using asteroids and zone-shifts. Find your enemy's weak spot and flick it into outer space!

112358.name: Matrix Runners
112358.description:
Players take the role of MATRIX RUNNERS (2-4 players) characters with unique advantages, disadvantages & specialty RIGS which they use to hack into the Cybernet.

Players take missions, complete them, hack into systems, enter battle arenas, invest in upgrading, or purchasing programs, and taking on more & more difficult challenges, all the while dodging traces, system guardians, & other players who may be trying to collect a bounty on them.

It's always risky engaging with other players in the net.
this provides them with the ability to trade or sell each other programs, or reveal information (for a price). But you never know if the mission they're on is to catch you & destroy you.
if you get caught, you can get fined, you programs can become corrupted, or you could face a serious virus is infecting your rig, or worse, eliminated!
It is a game of covert operations, espionage, and power. The more you earn the better the hardware & software you can buy, and become better equipped to move on to bigger and better things, but you never know who could be after you & who can be your ally.

The Year is 2055
The world is run by 3 major corporations,

GLOBE-E-TRON, E-Vision, and NOVA CORPS.
Sovereignty of Countries, and Governments have become obsolete.
The once known Internet has evolved into a vast Virtual Cybernet, where millions of people live out their
fantasy in virtual entertainment. The WORLD has become solely dependent on this Cybernet.
Corporations that virtually govern the world have reputation to uphold,
so they hire MATRIX RUNNERS to do their dirty work.
Sometimes these RUNS, include:
Hacking Important information on a new product,
Retrieve info on corporate activity,
Eliminate the competition by destroying their system.
Other jobs include hunting down other hackers as well,
Because of this vast underground employment market, a secret organization has developed an agency to facilitate
these jobs, keeping both the employer, and runner safe and anonymous.
This AGENCY also provides illegal programs to registered RUNNERS & provides them with jobs.
They are simply referred to as THE AGENCY.
It is a dangerous world of Intrigue, Deception, Skill, and Subterfuge. Noone is truly safe, and anyone can be traced and Eliminated. Tread carefully, young Runner...

112359.name: Nuzoo
112359.description: Party game. Twelve pictures of composite animals are placed around the room. During the party, guests look at the pictures and write down the animals that make up each image. The one who gets the most right answers, wins.

112360.name: What's Wrong?
112360.description:
Party game, with 16 cards, all with at least one thing wrong in the picture.

Cards are distributed around the room and guests are encouraged to look at the cards during the party, and to note down any faults they can see in the image. The one who gets the most right, wins.

112361.name: Jälkipyykki
112361.description:
All participants answer the same yes/no question about personal opinions or things done in the past at the same time by inserting a note in to the answer box. Then everyone makes a secret quess about the total number of "Yes"-answers. Those who get the correct answer get one point. The game ends when someone has 10 points.

Questions are designed for adults and might concer even outlaw things.

112362.name: Squadron Commander Reheat
112362.description:
From the rulebook Designer's note:

"The original version of SC3600 was developed and published by Mariner Games back in 1997. The original launch was accompanied by a small range of miniatures developed by Brigade Models. However the original designers, Patrick Doyle, Mike Tastsides and Doug Glover were serving members of the US armed forces and as such had more pressing demands on their time than playing games, so development of the rules understandably stalled.
[...] We've avoided unnecessary changes to the core rules, being content to tinker around the edges with minor changes to the design system and the inclusion of a hex-less movement system. Our main goal has been to streamline the rules a little without drastically altering the flavour. Probably the one major change has been to do away with the 12-point movement system that allowed movement along hex edges - we abandoned this in our own games very early on. We've also removed the distinction between the Basic and Advanced versions of the game in favour of a single unified set of rules."

The game uses miniatures of starfighters, it is played on a hex map but a set of rules to use hexless maps is also included. The main dice roll used is the 2d6 roll, this is modified by another kinf of dice (ranging from a d4 to a d12) based on the pilot skill. These dice rolls are used to resolve fights and control rolls when your fighter is going spinning around due to damages or wrong manouvers. The damage system is very interesting, being it not the "classic" set of boxes that have to be crossed out but a system that takes in account a series of debilitating damages that during the game, imposing each a number of malus and penalties, can render your fighter inoperative or totally destroyed. Statistics for the official fighter models are in the end of the book.

These are introductory free rules, Brigade Models is going to publish in a near future more complete rules (this time you are going to buy them) that will also include campaign games rules, pilots' skill progression and others more convoluted situations not presented here.

112363.name: Dr. Kinkin Bacteriapanic
112363.description: Japanese card game that has numbered sickness cards and numbered medicine cards. When you get sickness and medicine card with same number, you can throw them away. First player to get rid of all hand cards wins the game.

112364.name: Outside the Box
112364.description:
ABOUT THE GAME

Outside the Box™ was designed to be unique in many ways. First of all, the box top or cover actually becomes the game board (we don’t think anyone has ever done this before), hence the name Outside the Box. Secondly, it is a team game (there are very few team games out there) where everyone is actively involved throughout the game. This makes it a great party game, but also gives every single player a chance to be a hero by helping his or her team win. Most importantly, Outside the Box is all skill. There are no dice. Teams can only advance by getting the answers right. It’s very fast. It’s very fun and it’s very, very addictive.

GAME PLAY

Outside the Box™ consists of four types of rounds: Volley Box, Team Play, To Each His Own, and Speed Round. In most rounds, answers are given, in order, A through Z. Teams begin on the Start square with a Volley Box round. The team that wins the Volley Box moves onto the board to the first Team Play space, receives 3 PassCards, and will play the first Team Play round. As your teams progress through the game, you advance through 3 phases, and the 377 categories become more challenging. To win the game, you leave Phase 3, flip over the Start square (which reveals the Winner's Box), and attempt your Final Challenge.

FOUR ROUNDS OF PLAY

With four different rounds and hundreds of categories, it's like playing four games in one...so it's never the same, as it changes each time you play. Here are some examples:

Team Play - You have been chosen as the Captain of your team for this round. The category is: "Musical Groups and Rock Bands." The timer is set for 2 minutes, and the pressure is on! You must go, in order, A through Z, and name a group or band that begins with each letter of the alphabet. Your team may help you, but only by giving you "outside the box" clues. Did you just say, "That's easy?" Ready, set, go!

Volley Box - In this round, teams battle back and forth through the alphabet in a verbal hot potato! The category is: "Things you give, share, or offer to others." The timer is placed away from view and is set for 1 minute. Again, going in order, A through Z, the first team could shout, "Alimony!" The other team might respond with, "Benefit of the doubt!" The first team says, "Condolences!" (or "Cup of sugar!" or "Custody!" or "CPR!" or "Coat!") The team that is stuck when the timer beeps loses the round. Just how far "outside the box" will you go to help your team win?

To Each His Own - The category is picked and 4 letters are randomly chosen from the alphabet. Both teams are given 2 minutes to secretly write down a response for each letter. Try not to match each other. If you're really good, you may just get the chance to "stump the Master!"

Speed Round - You are the "Actor." You have picked a Speed Round card and the timer is set. You must go in order through the alphabet and get your team to say exactly what is on that card. Go ahead, jump around, sing, use props -- but you better not say any part of the words on the card, or "it sounds like" or "rhymes with.." The timer is going... what are you waiting for?

CONTENTS

Included are 377 category cards with thousands of possible answers (which makes the game different each time you play). The Master List is a three year compilation of well over 15,000 possible responses in which you could get the chance to stump the “Master” by coming up with your own “outside the box” answers. Also included is an audio CD featuring the inventor of the game, Rick Sugarman, explaining the rules. There are also live unscripted role playing examples, as well as helpful hints. In addition, the game comes complete with easy-to-follow, learn-as-you-play instructions and quick reference cards, an electronic digital programmable timer (battery included), team game pawns, scoring chips, letter cards, and PassCards.

112365.name: Stone Age
112365.description:
User Summary

Stone Age is a puzzle game set in the prehistoric era. The player controls Little Dragon and has to manoveur him through each of the 100 levels towards the exit, using moving platforms as well as teleporters and keys to unlock doors.

112366.name: Rags to Riches: The Financial Market Simulation

112368.name: Hermetic Projects
112368.description:
Publisher blurb:

You are an Hermetic magus, one of the greatest wielders of magic Mythic Europe has ever seen. You can control the winds with a word, the beasts with a gesture. You can create a forest in a matter of moments, and destroy castles with a thought. No secret of mortal man is safe from your investigation.

So, what do you do with all that power?

Build a covenant inside a volcano, or a tower that touches the sky. Construct enchanted ships to sail any ocean, or even on the clouds. Collect magical beasts from across Mythic Europe and beyond, or become the most deadly opponent in Wizard's War that the Order has ever seen. You could even cheat death itself.

This book describes the spells and enchantments needed to achieve these marvels, using the Hermetic magic taught to every apprentice of the Order of Hermes.

What wonders will you create?

112372.name: Royal Envoy 2
112372.description:
Team up with Cedric once again, for another exciting adventure! The King turns once more to you, his trusted city planner, to travel to the faraway land of Middleshire devasted due to the poor management and negligence of its rulers. Here you will be greeted by a host of zany new characters, and meet a few old favorites. Explore ancient caves and forgotten mines, meet mystical nymphs and leprechauns, engage in snowball fights in the frigid arctic, and rescue the people of Middleshire from the fires of a terrible volcano. With you as their guide, the people will build a veritable paradise - while you win prizes for your speed and quick wit!

63 unique levels and 30 bonus challenges
Over 60 achievements to unlock
Lots of all-new quests
New game modes (night and fog)
An exciting story with zany characters
Making-of
Animated screensaver and gorgeous wallpapers
Original soundtrack




Source: The Publisher Website.

112373.description: BraveRats, first released as R, is a simple and short simultaneous action selection game for two that's played with cards. Both players have a hand of eight cards, numbered 0 to 7, with each card having a special power. Both players choose a card, then reveal them simultaneously. The highest card wins the round, and players play until someone has won four rounds. The cards' special powers greatly influence the game.
112373.name: BraveRats
boardgamepodcastepisode: 11 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Travel Games
Episode 78-- Star Studded Origins 2014 Wrap Up
GenCon 2014 - Blue Orange
Giochi da spiaggia, ed. 2016 – Il Dado Incantato #8
The Party Gamecast Reviews - Braverats

112374.description:
User summary:
A simple dice game starring characters from Toho fame. Players take turns rolling the character dice. Any character but the Fairy Queen may be kept and the others rerolled. A three-dice, full house, four-dice or five-dice (of anything but the Fairy Queen) is worth points. Also, the quartet of all four idiots (Cirno, Lumia, Wriggle and Mystia) plus Fairy Queen also gives points.

The first player to a set number of points wins.

The games comes with 5 dice, a score sheet and a handkerchief to roll the dice on.

For 1 to 5 players, aged older than the March Fairy.
112374.name: Baquartet

112375.name: Risu-Game-On
112375.description:
User summary:

A Dominion-esque Japanese small press deck building game based on web-based role playing game "False Island". All players start with a small set of cards containing money and some victory points, and may each turn play cards from their hand to purchase better cards. The cards available for purchase vary each turn, as they are drawn and displayed 4 at a time from a shuffled pile of various cards. Money cards and victory point cards can always be drawn.

112376.name: Risu-Game-On Plus
112376.description:
User Summary:

A Japanese amateur Dominion-esque card game. Each player starts with a small deck of cards containing money and some VP and during the course of the game buys more cards from a common card pool.

Expands Risu-Game-On.

112377.name: Risu-Game-On 3 Deadly Strike
112377.description:
User Summary:

A Japanese amateur Dominion-esque card game. Players start with a small deck of cards containing money and some few victory points, and may each turn buy more cards from a common card pool, gradually increasing their decks.

The player with the most victory points in their decks once the game ends wins.

Expands Risu-Game-On and Risu-Game-On Plus

112378.description:
User summary:

A Japanese amateur card game, featuring characters of Shrine Maiden fame. The game simulates a race, and the deck of cards consists of character cards with numbers 1–6 and special powers of varying sorts. Each player starts with a hand of 5 cards, and each turn draws a card and may choose to play a card on theiur own "route" (representing that they are advancing), onto another player (representing an enemy), or generally using a card's special power. The player may also choose to score one of their route cards. Defeating enemies that other players have played on you may also generate points.

Once at 5 route cards, the stage is cleared and the player receives one of the route cards as stage clear bonus, and once a player has cleared 4 stages, the game ends at which point the player with the highest amount of points wins.
112378.name: Story of Eastern Illusionary Light

112379.description:
User summary:

A "Great Dalmuti" type card game featuring characters of Shrine Maiden fame. The card deck consists of cards numbered 1–15 and a special power. Each player gets 7 cards. The first player may play 1 or more cards (several cards of the same number or a straight), and the players who follow must play as many or more cards as the previous player and the total value must also be higher. Each time one or several card(s) are played, the effect of one of the played card is executed. Players who cannot play must pass. Once everyone around the table has passed, the played cards are discarded and the current players begins anew with playing one or several cards.

The first player to get rid of his hand wins the round. The game is played for several rounds, with the winner of the previous round getting an advantage for the next round.
112379.name: Myon's Errand Game

112380.name: DungeonMania
112380.description:
User summary:

A home-made "Hero Quest" type game. The game is played on a square-gridded board representing a dungeon. One player takes the role of the Dungeon Master, the other players are heroes trying to defeat and clear each scenarion.

The game contains a game board, rulebook with 10 scenarios and cut-out markers for all enemies and items.

112381.description:
Game description from the publisher:

It's the distant future, and mankind has taken a galactic leap forward through space, time, and technology. Life as we know it struggles to endure on the Abaddon. Once the home of a mysterious, non-human civilization, the planet is now a desolate wasteland bearing one immensely precious resource: Feronium power crystals. The unimaginable energy contained within the crystals is coveted by two groups of humans: the Satellite City-States and the Commonwealth Alliance. Using Links – giant bio-mech suits made from modified military vehicles and alien technology – the warring factions fight a weary battle for territorial control of the Abaddon.

At your disposal in Abaddon is a 28" x 19" battlefield game board with 32 highly-detailed mech figurines, 18 free-standing landscape terrain features, over 100 game-changing Wild Fire and Weapon System cards, dozens of tokens, battle dice and a Battle Manual containing over 15 mission scenarios. Choose your allegiance and lead your army in non-stop excitement as you forge through unforgiving terrain, fight to overcome random and bizarre technological glitches, and battle your enemies in never-ending war.

Abaddon is a furious, two-to-four-player game of futuristic combat. Each scenario is laid out on the customizable battlefield game board with each side using a varying number of units. The game is played in turns during which a player rolls his Activation Dice, allowing him to "activate" certain units and move them. These mechanical units – Links – are powered by Feronium power crystals, and as they take damage these crystals are depleted. A unit that runs out of crystals is unable to continue functioning and is considered destroyed.

Combat is card- and dice-based. The attacker lays out his Weapon System cards, targeting defending enemy units. Once the attacker has laid out all of his planned attacks, the defender may defend with his own Weapon System cards. These cards can modify the dice rolls that are used to determine the results of the combat. Additionally, due to the experimental nature of the Links and the mysterious happenings in the Abaddon region, things can, and often will, go wrong. These malfunctions and odd happenings are represented by Wild Fire cards, the drawing of which can result in anything from possible shutdowns to anti-gravity surges.

Victory is determined based on stipulations presented by the chosen mission scenarios. Typically, victory is achieved by damaging and destroying your opponent's units by way of their power crystals. Each destroyed enemy crystal is worth one victory point, which players must collect in order to win.
112381.name: Abaddon
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 64: Richard Borg
Wooden Cubes & Iron Soldiers: “Just the Two of Us” Episode 8

112382.name: Witch: The Road to Lindisfarne (Ashcan Edition)
112382.description:
Back cover blurb:

It is the year of our Lord 1350 and an unholy plague sweeps across our beloved Britain. Measures have been taken to contain and eliminate it, but still families must surrender their mothers, fathers, sons and daughters to the mass graves.

They say that one in three have been marked for death. But marked by whom? Are the sick being punished for their sins by God?

No, this foul curse is the work of the Devil and his wicked agent, the Witch.

The people pray for an answer, and within the great city of London, the source of the vile plague, God may have given it. A woman has been taken prisoner by the Church after confessing the use of Witchcraft to bring the blight upon us.

Three days have passed since then and during this time the heads of the church have been in consultation without rest. Today they emerged and gave their counsel.

The woman must be taken in a caged cart to the Holy Island of Lindisfarne. Once there, an ancient ritual will be performed to cleanse this land of her and her black plague.

It will take two weeks to reach the site, but as the sun breaks the horizon on the Sabbath then the Witch will face her absolution.

This is the story of that journey.

112383.description:
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE is a Card Game of survival horror where 2-4 players each control groups of Humans and Zombies in an effort to survive the Zombie Apocalypse. Humans are greatly outnumbered, but are able to use Weapons and Refuges for protection. Cards like Zombie Horde and Reinforcements can quickly change momentum, but be especially careful of the Zombie Apocalypse card which always keeps the Humans' chances of survival slim at best. In the end, the player with the most Humans and Zombies left standing (or shamblimg), as well as in their Kill Pile, is declared the winner.
With various "Theme Decks" available (which pushes the number of unique cards in the game to nearly 300), there is a simplified Deck Building system in place that allows some customization while keeping deck strengths equal. Deck Building is more about "atmosphere" than anything else in ZA.
Finally, all cards use stunning photography! Each card bleeds creepiness and dark humor unlike anything ever seen in a Zombie card game.
112383.name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE Card Game
boardgameexpansion: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Better Red Than Undead
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Crisis Event  Promo Cards
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Epic Zombie Horde Promo Card
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Night of the Thinking Dead
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Slashers, Killers, and Creepers
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Til Un-Death Do Us Part
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Zombie Card Game & Zombie Twins Promo
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE: Zombie Grizzly Promo Card

112384.description:
Word on the Street: Expansion 1 includes 216 new double-sided category cards (as well as an additional timer) for use with the Word on the Street base game.

For those not familiar with the game, in Word on the Street, players - either individually or in teams – try to claim letter tiles from the game board.

To set up the game, seventeen letter tiles (all the consonants in English other than j, q, x, and z) are placed in a strip down the center of the game board – the median strip of the street, if you will, which has two "traffic lanes" on either side of it. On a turn, one team is presented with a category such as "types of fruit" or "something a player is wearing", and that team has thirty seconds to come up with an answer in that category, then move the letters in that word toward their side of the game board. Any letters in the word that are not on the game board are skipped. If the answer were "pineapple", for example, the team would move P, N, P, P and L.

If a team moves a letter off the game board, it has claimed that letter and that tile will not move for the remainder of the game. The first team to claim eight letter tiles wins!
112384.name: Word on the Street: Expansion 1
boardgamepodcastepisode: Game Gab: Gen Con 2011: Leah Sugar: Out of the Box
TPGC - Episode #8 - Word on the Street and Funglish

From publisher blurb:

Spookybeans is the role-playing game of gothic underground comics. This game allows players to explore a morbidly funny comic book world in the vein of Charles Addams, Tim Burton, Roman Dirge, Edward Gorey, Ted Naifeh, Jill Thompson, Serena Valentino, Johnen Vasquez, and Voltaire (among others).

Features:

Fast, simple system
Create characters in two minutes or less
Use any kind of dice you want
Mechanics designed to keep players engaged (even when it's not their turn)




From now on, every day is Halloween...

112386.name: Dragons
112386.description:
User Summary

A platform game by Amsoft. Each level features clouds linked together by vines which the player can climb. There are gems and dragons on the clouds, and a dragon which drops eggs from the top of the screen. The goal of each level is to eliminate the dragons by pushing the eggs on them. Gems can be picked up for bonus points.

112387.name: Faux•Cabulary: Expansion 1
112387.description:
Faux•Cabulary: Expansion 1 includes fifteen new word cubes and sixty new cards (with 120 definitions) for use with the Faux•Cabulary base game.

For those not familiar with the game, in Faux•Cabulary, players create new words for descriptions that lack appropriate nomenclature by using randomly drawn "word segment" dice included in the game.

Each round, one player is the Wordmeister while the other players draw three word cubes at random from the box. The Wordmeister reads a Faux•Cabulary card out loud, e.g., "The compulsion to pop bubblewrap", then each player creates a word using 1-3 of his cubes – perhaps "Bust-O-Ific" – and conceals the word in a plastic holder. The Wordmeister mixes the words in their plastic holders (so that she doesn't know who created which word), reveals them one-by-one, then awards the card to whoever submitted the word that (in her mind) best matches the definition. Players then return all the dice, and the Wordmeister position rotates clockwise. Whoever claims the required number of Faux•Cabulary cards first wins!

112388.name: Faux•Cabulary: Expansion 2
112388.description:
Faux•Cabulary: Expansion 2 includes twelve new word cubes and sixty new cards (with 120 definitions) for use with the Faux•Cabulary base game.

For those not familiar with the game, in Faux•Cabulary, players create new words for descriptions that lack appropriate nomenclature by using randomly drawn "word segment" dice included in the game.

Each round, one player is the Wordmeister while the other players draw three word cubes at random from the box. The Wordmeister reads a Faux•Cabulary card out loud, e.g., "The compulsion to pop bubblewrap", then each player creates a word using 1-3 of his cubes – perhaps "Bust-O-Ific" – and conceals the word in a plastic holder. The Wordmeister mixes the words in their plastic holders (so that she doesn't know who created which word), reveals them one-by-one, then awards the card to whoever submitted the word that (in her mind) best matches the definition. Players then return all the dice, and the Wordmeister position rotates clockwise. Whoever claims the required number of Faux•Cabulary cards first wins!

112403.name: The Anger Solution Card Game
112403.description:
This game was designed to teach children constructive and effective ways to resolve their anger. The cards allow them the opportunity to choose alternatives that can turn anger-inciting situations into more positive encounters. Through repetitive game play, they will learn how to use the new solutions in real life to avoid negative reactions. The object of the the game is for players to resolve as many anger-inciting situations as they can within a 20-30-minute periods. Players get chips for resolving anger situations, and the player with the most chips wins the game.

Contents:
20 People cards
40 Situation cards
40 Solution cards (four sets of 10)
100 Chips
Instructions

User Summary

112406.name: Gopher
112406.description:
Box Description:

Gopher is a one or two player, full color game designed to be played on the Atari Video Computer System or the Sears Video Arcade.

Gophers have launched a merciless assault on your carrot patch. Grab your shovel and fill those holes before they tunnel out and eat your choice carrots. With no time to run back to the barn for more seeds to plant, it's a good thing that crazy duck keeps flying by and dropping them. But it's awfully tricky to catch a seed, plant it, and still keep those persistent Gophers away. Just when you think everything's under control, they get faster and hungrier! Take a deep breath, and let the battle begin.

112407.name: Buzz Bombers
112407.description:
User Summary

Mattel response for the Atari game centipede, released in 1983.
You control a spray can and must shot the moving bees, so they will become static honeycombs, that must be shot also. Eventually, a hummingbird can help you with the honeycomb

112408.name: Globulation 2
112408.description:
Globulation 2 brings a new type of gameplay to RTS games. The player chooses the number of units to assign to various tasks, and the units do their best to satisfy the requests. This allows players to manage more units and focus on strategy rather than on micro-management.

Source: The Game Website.

Phantasy Star Online Ver. 2 is an enhanced sequel/remake of the original. The new features include:

- New multiplayer online games including soccer and 4 deathmatch games.
- Two new areas to explore: the ruins and the spaceship.
- An expanded character creation wardrobe and customization options.

112412.description:
User Summary

Cruise Ship Resort is a compilation of 8 mini-games based on a cruise ship. Players can work through Career Mode or play individual games in Free Play.

112413.name: Cruis'n
112413.description:
Cruis'n was released for the Wii in 2007. This game is developed by Just Games Interactive, and published by Midway Games. The race starts in New York's Times Square, and ends in Los Angeles's Muholland Drive. The objective of this game is to outrun seven different cars by cruising through twelve different courses, doing different kind of stunts, and using the new nitrous system. This game introduces the money system which you gain money to unlock new cars. When you start the game only four tracks and four cars where unlocked. Along the way you unlock different stages and cars by gaining money or racing in the Circuit Challenge. This game allows up to two players on the track.

Back in 2001, another Cruis'n game was planned to be in for works for the Nintendo Gamecube as a console conversion of Cruis'n Velocity, but the idea was scrapped. But in 2006, Midway was planning to bring The Fast and the Furious to home consoles, but lost the license during the game's production cycle. Midway then changed the name of the game to Cruis'n and hired game developers Just Games Interactive to develop the game for the Nintendo Gamecube, but then the project was moved to the Wii shortly after the development has started. The game was announced in the summer of 2007 and was planned for release on the Wii exclusive.

During the summer of 2007, Midway released three screenshots demonstrating somewhat dated graphics. Later, Midway released additional screenshots and announced a two-player mode as well as a car customization feature for the game like its original arcade counterpart The Fast and the Furious. A few months later, Midway released the game, despite experiencing some manufacturing difficulties.

Cruis'n fared poorly in reviews by both gamers and critics. Many thought it was a slapped-together version of The Fast and the Furious arcade game with few new features. The main areas of criticism were its outdated gameplay, poor sound, lack of extra features (the title is a straight port), and lack of depth; the game can be beaten in less than an hour. Its loading times were considered problematic as it takes up to a minute to load and start a race. The game's graphics were also heavily criticized for resembling a game from the Nintendo 64 era. The game was often praised for its responsive controls, but the overall experience of the game was hampered by its other flaws. Some reviews expressed the belief that Cruis'n was a quick cash-out for Midway.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cruis'n", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112414.name: Daisy Fuentes Pilates
112414.description:
Set at a lush tropical resort and hosted by Daisy Fuentes, Daisy Fuentes Pilates features customizable workouts, fitness tracking real-time coaching and interactive feedback.

Daisy Fuentes Pilates, the first self-titled Pilates endeavor, goes beyond the one-way, static workouts of traditional DVDs using the Wii’s controls to monitor movements and offer instant feedback, ensuring proper body motion so players get the most from every Pilates session. Players stay on track following the integrated, on-screen timing bar as well as the real-time feedback from Daisy Fuentes herself, whose voice guides the exercises. Players will be able to choose between English and Spanish.

Source: The Developer Website.

112415.name: Dance Dance Revolution: Disney Grooves
112415.description:
Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves is a video game in the North American Dance Dance Revolution series for the Nintendo Wii by Konami. It was released on April 2, 2009, Disney Grooves is the third DDR title for the Wii and the fourth Disney title in the music video game's series. According to a press release published by Konami Digital Entertainment on October 7, 2008, Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves features greater integration with the Wii such as support for dancing Miis which can dress up in Disney-related costumes, dancing versions of classic Disney characters such as Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck and Goofy, as well as gameplay centered around challenging players and rewarding them with new content in-game. At least 40 songs from Disney are playable, ranging from famous movie scores to dance remixes of classic songs including "It's a Small World", "A Spoonful of Sugar", "Zip-a-Dee-Doo-Dah" and "Circle of Life". Disney Grooves supports up to four players using dance pad controllers, two of which are included with the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dance Dance Revolution Disney Grooves", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112416.name: Dance Dance Revolution: Hottest Party 2
112416.description:
Dance Dance Revolution Hottest Party 2 was announced by Konami on May 15, 2008 as part of the 10th anniversary of Dance Dance Revolution celebration. Hottest Party 2 features the same gameplay as the first Hottest Party and introduces new gameplay modes, gimmicks, characters and graphical enhancements. The game also features an all new soundtrack featuring licensed music from the past four decades as well as new Konami Originals.

Gameplay remains relatively unchanged from the original game. New modes on Hottest Party 2 include a new battle mode and the "Groove Arena", an updated version of Groove Circuit from the previous version. New additional arrow gimmicks include arrows that rebound when hit and must be hit three times in order for them to fully disappear, arrows that only appear suddenly, missiles, and an implementation of holds for the hand markers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dance Dance Revolution Hottest Party 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112417.name: Crayola Art Adventure
112417.description:
Something strange is happening in the Crayola™ Gallery. The color is disappearing from the artwork! Solve puzzles to help the Pip-Squeaks™ crack the case and restore the pictures. Then create your own artwork using Crayola colors and tools.

Features expanded play for the Leapster2 system that lets Leapster2 players connect online for extra games, activities and rewards. Parents can get detailed learning progress reports through the online LeapFrog® Learning Path. Appropriate for children ages 3 to 7 years (pre-K to grade 1).

Works with Leapster and Leapster2 systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112418.name: August 1914
112418.description:
User Summary

A boardgame style, operational level, DOS computer game of the first three months of combat on the Western Front during World War I.

112419.name: Disney Pixar's Cars 2 (Leapster)
112419.description:
he heart-pounding, tire-blazing World Grand Prix is underway, and Mater and Lightning McQueen are caught up in the excitement! When Mater becomes part of a top-secret spy mission, help him by collecting cool gear while playing 6 high-octane mathematics games.

Features expanded play for the Leapster2 system, so Leapster2 players can connect online for extra games, activities and rewards, and parents can get detailed learning progress reports through the online LeapFrog® Learning Path. Appropriate for children ages 4 to 7 years (grades pre-K to 1). Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112420.name: Disney Pixar's Cars: Supercharged
112420.description:
Join the Cars characters on a wild ride to rev up phonics, spelling, vocabulary skills and more!
• Teaches phonics skills, spelling, language arts and vocabulary.
• Bump the f with the right plural ending as you zip around cacti and tumbleweeds.
• Honk at motor homes with the right letters to catch up to Mack.
• Enhance your car with new paint, custom body jobs and performance tires.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Coloring Page and Achievement Certificate rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld™, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112421.name: Defend the Alamo
112421.description:
User Summary

A solitaire version of the Defense of the Alamo

112422.name: Dora's Camping Adventure
112422.description:
Explore animal facts and more on an amazing wildlife rescue adventure with Dora, Boots and Diego!
• Teaches Spanish and English vocabulary: animal names, fruit and vegetable names, shapes, colors and numbers.
• Answer vocabulary questions to help Dora rescue supplies from the river.
• Learn the Spanish names for fruits and vegetables while on a yummy hike through the forest.
• Sing along with Dora and Boots to English and Spanish versions of classic camping songs.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Achievement Certificate rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld™, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112423.name: SpongeBob SquarePants Saves the Day
112423.description:
Use your knowledge of numbers, money and more to help SpongeBob collect ingredients for a new and improved Krabby Patty Sauce!
• Teaches reading and phonics, math and money, logic and classification.
• Bring the "Claw game" to life by adding up the correct number of coins.
• Burst bubbles to capture the letters on the jellyfish and create words.
• Use logic skills to create different Krabby Patty sauces for Patrick to test!
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access an earned Coloring Page and Achievement Certificate rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld™, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112424.name: Mr. Pencil's Learn to Draw and Write
112424.description:
Learn how to write letters and numbers, draw and use art techniques to make your own masterpiece!
• Teaches drawing, handwriting and color theory.
• Follow along in interactive lessons that help you write upper- and lowercase letters and numbers 1-10.
• Make an animated flip book, color pictures or play fun creative games.
• Draw animals, shapes and cartoons as you explore techniques like shading and perspective.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Achievement Certificate rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld™, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112425.name: Disney's Tangled
112425.description:
Join Rapunzel and the handsome bandit Flynn on a hair-raising escapade! Follow their adventure as you build words, get practice with spelling skills and unlock tools to create your own works of art!

• Teaches word building, spelling and creative expression.
• Unscramble words and braid Rapunzel’s golden hair!
• Pull the glowing lanterns from the sky to spell words!
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112432.name: Tsushima
112432.description:
User Summary

Recreates the climatic naval engagement of the Russo-Japanese war of 1904 through 1905. By Hayes Thomas.

112435.name: Space Station Zulu
112435.description:
User Summary

Use strategy and a variety of weapons and tools to find and eradicate all the aliens who've infested your ship.

112436.name: Under Southern Skies
112436.description:
User Summary

A simulation of the exploits and sinking of the German Pocket Battleship Graf Spee. Either solitaire (computer is British) or two player, USS has a strategic as well as tactical game.

112437.name: Grand Theft Auto (GBA)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112437.description:
Box Description:

It was supposed to be the last job you and Vinnie would do for the mob. After this, you'd both have enough money to escape Liberty City for good. Then Vinnie's getaway car went up in a ball of flames, along with all the cash. Suddenly every cop in the city is chasing you down. You're determined to get out of Liberty City, but not before you find Vinnie's murderers and turn the tables on whomever it is that's out to get you.

Open-ended gameplay that provides hours of portable entertainment.

An all-new, revenge driven storyline that puts you on the tail of your mentor's murderers.

Explore and exploit a huge, sprawling Liberty City - in the palm of your hand.

112438.name: Greg Hastings' Tournament Paintball Max'd
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112438.description:
Box Description:

Experience the ultra-fast paced action of the Sport of Combat. Travel the globe and play 100's of field layouts inspired by top pro leagues. Fire realistic markers up to 24 balls per second. Avoid your opponents' 200 mile per hour streams of paint by diving and jumping into the closest bunkers for cover. Nothing gets you closer to the realistic intensity of professional paintball.

Real players

Real gear

Real teams

New Max'd Features:

-Leap over low bunkers

-Realistic dual trigger action

-100's of professionally inspired tournament fields

-Authentic gear from Smart Parts, Eclipse, Empire, and more

-Play as Bob Long, Alex Lundquist, Jon Richardson, and more

-Customize tournaments in single player, co-op, or multiplayer.

112439.name: GT Pro Series
112439.description:
Box Description:

Grab the wheel and hang on tight.

Race 80+ authentically modeled cars, each with 11 tunable components.

Split-screen multiplayer modes for up to 4 players.

Dominate the competition in drift mode by mastering awesome drift combos.

112441.name: Total War: Shogun 2 – Rise of the Samurai Campaign
112441.description:
A new DLC campaign entitled Rise of the Samurai was released September 27, 2011. This release includes a new campaign based on the Gempei War, set 400 years prior to the original game, as well as new units and agents.

Source: Wikipedia, "Total War: Shogun 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112442.name: Thunder Fox
112442.description:
User Summary

Side scrolling action game set in 199x. Player controls one of two members of the counter terrorism squad Thunder Fox fighting against a global "storm" of terrorism.

112444.name: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Patriots
112444.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Tom Clancy's Rainbow 6: Patriots is an upcoming video game, part of the Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six series and set to be released in 2013. It is published by Ubisoft, and is developed by the company's Ubisoft Montreal, with additional development by Ubisoft Toronto and Ubisoft Red Storm. The company posted a "gameplay target" trailer on YouTube on November 4, 2011. The video shows a pre-rendered version of what the final game might appear like, rather than what it actually looks like at the moment. Similar to previous games in the series, Rainbow 6: Patriots is a squad-based game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Patriots", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112445.description:
The Earth is probably doomed, and rumors and speculation run rampant. Newspaper headlines from across the globe stir the populace to desperation:

"MELTING POLAR ICE CAPS" "RISING SEA LEVELS" "POLLUTION!" "OVERPOPULATION!" "NUCLEAR WINTER?" "RAVENOUS BLACK STAR GOATS?" "WILL METEORS STRIKE YOUR CHILDREN?" "DISASTER LOOMS!"

The race to escape Earth has begun! With the world's nations in decline, powerful corporations now stand as humanity's last hope. Take the reins of one such corporation, as CEO, and venture out into space. With your mission in hand; build ships, collect resources, research technologies, survive the dangers of space exploration, and, while ticket sales hold steady, preserve the human race. Remember to stay a step ahead of competing corporations, which can use slick marketing campaigns and 10 cent tchotchkes to buy the loyalty of the people you just saved from certain doom!

In Disaster Looms!, players are rewarded points for sticking to the mission and building colonies, and saving colonists. As you are a CEO you are also rewarded points for filling the Corporate treasury, and building the company's value proposition by retaining rights to the best technologies. Gameplay is fast, and exciting. Events, and the vast variety of hazards that space has to offer will keep you on your toes, and your underlings busy on the paperwork for decades to come!

The game is played in five phases: Research, Fleet, Management, Revenue, and finally First Player Turn Auction. All players will complete each phase, in turn order, before proceeding to the next phase. This helps to keep the game moving, and keeps players engaged. In Research phase players can pay to research, or choose to license another players tech. In the Fleet phase players get one action with each ship they own. The Management phase is when players build new ships, special tech items, and sell technology to the public domain. The Revenue phase is when players collect their hard earned resources, including a small stipend from their home office on Earth. And finally, the turn auction phase is a bidding war for who goes first. Not that important at the start of the game, but monumental for the end.
112445.name: Disaster Looms!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Funding the Dream on Kickstarter Ep 65 Eric Salyers Getting Published in the US

112447.name: Andro Dunos
112447.description:
From the back of the box:

Enter a world of vivid color, imagination, and space fantasy. A mission to decieve enemy guard in this bold new frontier. Pilot the awesome space fighter through the treacherous corridors of space. The newly developed fighter is equipped with multiple armament configurations that can be powered up 4 times. Three way and lasers are included in this arsenal and is enough to blow the enemies into moon dust.
This horizontal scrolling space shoot them up is made for 2 player simultaneous play. Spectacular graphics and digital stereo sound add to the attraction. The adventure of lifetime. The name of the game is.... ANDRO DUNOS.

112449.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 5 No 1 - Spring 2041)
112449.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Joe Goes On A Vacation, 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, The Winning Formula, In the Arena, Duel Slang, Combat Rock, The Showroom, Local Hero, Cube Logs, & Closing Fire.

112450.description:
Game description from the publisher:
Fight to win in Trial by Combat, the fifth Chapter Pack in the "A Tale of Champions" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. Individuals doomed to die may find champions to take their causes. Valiant heroes seeking to uphold justice may fall to the sword. Killers may become heroes...

The 60 cards (three copies each of 20 different cards) in Trial by Combat expand upon several of the dynamic new themes introduced in A Tale of Champions. Reinforce your ability to forge fleeting alliances with other melee players with new cards providing you and your allies mutual benefits. When the temporary alliances falter, use cards from Trial by Combat to play your opponents against each other. Unique characters and support cards bolster strategies featuring their House's most renowned personalities, and characters possessing the new Melee keyword continue to find clarity in the heat of battle.

An A Game of Thrones: The Card Game core set is required to play. Contains cards 81-100 of the "A Tale of Champions" series.
112450.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Trial by Combat
boardgameexpansion: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

112452.description:
Crime & Mystery: Lost Bakerstreet Files provides new exciting stories for clever investigators and is a part of the Crime & Mystery family. They have to solve the mysteries of these stories, which the police could not solve.

The players are cadets of Scotland Yard, who create stories about one of the prime suspects in a murder case using "evidence" cards. On the back of the card, the players decode a question with a red foil. If you answer these questions correctly, it will lead you to the murderers.

Crime & Mystery: Lost Bakerstreet Files is the sequal to the uncommon und innovative criminal game Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files. The players have to listen closely and remember and combine the facts in the right way to find the murder and win the game.


Neue Fälle der ganz anderen Art erwarten die Ermittler. Es gilt, Fälle zu lösen, welche die Polizei selbst nicht lösen konnte und nun zu den Akten legen will. Doch nicht, wenn es nach dem Willen des scharfsin nigsten Ermittlerteams von ganz London geht.

In Crime & Mystery: Lost Bakerstreet Files, der Fortsetzung des ungewöhnlichen Kriminal-Spiels Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files muss man genau zuhören können, messerscharf kombinieren und braucht ein erstklassiges Gedächtnis, um anhand der Indizien und Hinweise, den oder die tatsächlichen Täter zu überführen. Lost Bakerstreet Files kann separat oder zusammen mit den Bakerstreet Files gespielt werden.
112452.name: Crime & Mystery: Lost Bakerstreet Files

112453.description:
A new murder at East Highway. There is no time to lose before the hints are lost. Due to new methods there are new ways to discover the murder for the investigators. Find root of hairs, fingerprints and autopsy dead bodies.

The players are cadets of Scotland Yard, who create stories about one of the prime suspects in a murder case using "evidence" cards. On the back of the card, the players decode a question with a red foil. If you answer these questions correctly, it will lead you to the murderers.

Crime & Mystery: Modern Investigation is a deductive game for 3 to 6 investigators. It is a part of the Crime & Mystery family and is based on the mechanism of Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files. It puts the investigation into the setting of CSI in the USA.


Schon wieder ein Mord am East Highway. Wie immer gilt es, keine Zeit zu verlieren. Die Spuren müssen gesichert werden, bevor sie verloren gehen. Dank den neuesten Methoden der Wissenschaft, hat sich das Gesicht der Ermittlungen in solchen Fällen geändert. Haarwurzeln, Fingerabdrücke, Blutproben, Insektenlarven und präzise Autopsien ermöglichen eine ganz neue Form der Verbrechensbekämpfung. Und auch eine neue Art von Ermittlern.

Crime & Mystery: Modern Investigation ist ein deduktives Spiel für 3-6 Ermittler, das auf dem Spielmechanismus von Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files beruht und die Ermittlungen in das Setting der Crime Scene Investigation der USA führt.
112453.name: Crime & Mystery: Modern Investigation

112454.name: Bard Token Set
112454.description:
From the back of the packet:
Gale Force Nine's Dungeons & Dragons tokens let you take your game to the next level with durable, full color tokens customized to your character's class.

Set includes a Character Tile, 17 tokens, one Invisibility Stand-up, one Mount Token Base and one Action Point.

112455.description:
