112460.name: Automobility
112460.description:
Objective: be the first collecting 5 knowledge cards out of 5 different (coloured) theme areas:
versions & technology
milestones
sports
design
innovation & environment

- moving by turn -
During player's turn die is rolled, may move into any direction, but not vice versa; occupied spaces may be crossed.
Appropriate card is drawn, pick up question - if the answer is correct keep the card.
Board, 5 x 50 cards with more than 1000 questions
24 action cards, 6 meeples, 1 die, rule sheet

112461.name: No Response from Deepmar
112461.description:
From the back of the book:

A hundred miles off the Chelish coast lies the remote island of Deepmar, where the House of Thrune sends prisoners to work in crystal mines, wresting valuable spell components from the depths of the earth. A month ago, all contact with the penal colony ceased, and now someone must discover what mysterious fate has befallen the prisoners and guards of this isolated mining operation. The abandoned colony shows no signs of struggle yet something is clearly not right: Herds of animals lie mutilated in the surrounding fields. The savage beasts of the island have run amok inside the compound. And the silent, gaping mines—each named for a different layer of Hell—lead to new threats beyond anyone's imagining. As the PCs explore the island in search of the missing miners and their jailers, what they discover may unhinge their very minds. If left unchecked, the new masters of Deepmar could bring about a new era of madness for all of Cheliax—and beyond.

No Response from Deepmar is an adventure of horrifying dungeon-and-wilderness exploration for 8th-level characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world’s oldest RPG. This volume also contains a gazetteer of the island of Deepmar, a detailed description of the abandoned penal colony, and a brand-new monster, all of which can be easily adapted for use in any campaign setting.

112462.description:
Schlock Mercenary: Capital Offensive is a multi-player tactical shooter, played on a grid-based modular map, set in the popular Schlock Mercenary epic science fiction webcomic created by Howard Tayler. Players take on the roles of Tagon's Toughs and a variety of other characters while working to achieve scenario-specific goals.

Schlock Mercenary: Capital Offensive includes roughly one hundred pieces of original artwork, including top down floor tiles, plasma cannons, scanners, turrets, Teraport cages, and more. The game includes several scenarios, with more scheduled for release in future years.

Featured characters from the comic are Tagon, Elf, Schlock, Ennesby, Legs, Thurl, Kevin, Shodan, Elizabeth, Petey, and Partnership Collective Drones.
112462.name: Schlock Mercenary: Capital Offensive
boardgameexpansion: Schlock Mercenary: Kickstarter promotional items pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: Funding the Dream - Howard Tayler Episode 2

112463.name: Monsterman
112463.description:
"I've created a monster!"

The objetive of this game is to be the first one to complete a "Monster man" with all his body parts (head, arms, torso and legs). The mechanic it's a simple "retrieve a card from the deck, discard the one you don't need" (although there are several specific cards wich triggers special events) until you complete your monster. To achieve this, the player can use different parts, as long as the creature is complete.

112464.name: Witch: Oraakkelin kutsu
112464.description:
Game themed on Disney Italia's W.I.T.C.H. comic.
Each player has 5 pawns, and they race to get all the pawns to the center of the board while evading "banscáil"-pawn.

Contents:
Board
20 pawns (in 4 different colours)
Banscáil-pawn with base
2 dice
Rules

112465.name: Helinä-keiju: Helinä ja kastepisarat
112465.description:
Tinker-bell game.

Players try to get rid of all of their glass balls. First a player draws a card with a number or a simple calculation like 3-1, and then the player throws a die which shows either - or +. If the die shows +, player puts as many glass balls as was written on the card on the flower in the middle of the board. If the die shows - player takes glass balls from the flower. When the flower falls down, player has to take all the fallen glass balls.

112466.name: Dick Tracy ...jagt "Big Boy"
112466.description:
Objective: 2 players or two teams are attempting
A capture Big Boy or (Dick Tracy)
B get into head quarter (Big Boy)
- moving by turn -
player rolls the die & moves; if you meet an opponent you are going to fight (by die); loser is placed into the hospital, winner moves on.
Story is based upon the movie published 1990, where the cop Dick Tracy is trying to capture his arch enemy Big Boy Caprice

112467.name: Spin & Rescue Game
112467.description:
The aim of the game is to collect all 5 of your rescue cards by remembering where they are.

There is a big spinner in the middle of the table and players spin Fireman Sam as hard as they can!
If he stops by your marker, listen carefully to what is said.

Depending what Fireman Sam said player draws one or two rescue cards and if it is his hero on that card he takes it on his hand or if it's not puts it back in the circle around spinner.
But sometimes Norman is in trouble! Now player have to give back randomly one of his rescue card.

The first player to collect all their 5 hero cards wins!

112468.name: CityProGame Mainz Wiesbaden
112468.description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Mainz & Wiesbaden each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

112469.name: Macabre Tales
112469.description:
From the publisher:

Macabre Tales is the dominoes-based RPG of Lovecraftian horror that strips out the "contributions" of later authors and focuses solely on what Lovecraft himself created. Spectrum Games, known for accurate emulation of various genres in their products, offers a brand new take on role-playing in the terrifying and abhorrent world of Howard Phillips Lovecraft. Will you emerge from the experience unscathed? Or will your mind snap in the wake of all the hidden abominations that lurk in the shadows, just out of sight of humankind?

112470.name: Eight Man
112470.description:
From the back of the box

Super 8 Man, designed and built from the latest nuclear age technology, this incredibly agile robot moves at lightning speed and looks completely human, yet he is constructed with the most advanced internal computers and the strongest of steel.

Super 8 Man has the intelligence, thoughts, and memories of a great police detective programmed into his metaphysically driven processors. With great conviction, he defends the rights of mere mortals in order to maintain justice, and protects the world from a biological computer that threatens mankind.

112471.name: The Guild Companion (Feb 2011)
112471.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

112472.name: Ghost Pilots
videogameversion: North American Neo Geo CD edition
112472.description:
From the back of the box:

Bombs, Missiles, Bullets! Close to the end of the war, rumor of "A huge natural resource found in F Country" was spreading among countries suffering from lack of war supplies. Neutral F Country, with its antiquated military, suddenly became the target of super powers C and D Country. They became involved in the war. Exciting shooting game with dive-bombing and steep climbs by enemy jet fighters. Rush to the battlefield!

112473.name: The Guild Companion (Mar 2011)
112473.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

112474.description:
The year is 2450. The players, who represent different universities from around the world, will travel five hundred years back in time to the 20th century, where they will plan and deliver one of the great advances in that century. Each of these advances has some requirements on personnel, materials and funding. During the game players take turns to play cards on the table (while keeping some cards to achieve their secret agendas); the cards played on the table help in meeting the requirements, but as more cards are on the table there are more probabilities of problems arising in the common research (at the end of each turn a number of dice is rolled depending on the number of cards on the table, and the result of the dice roll sometimes forces to remove some cards). After 10 turns, players win if they have reached the requirements, and one of the players will be the top winner if he/she has also reached his/her secret agenda. If the players have not reached the requirements, they collectively lose.

Inventum is a game of collaboration that highlights the role universites play in transferring knowledge to the community at large and hereby contributing to our economic and social well-being.

The game is published with the support of the University of Barcelona and the Fundació Bosch i Gimpera, from an original proposal by Marga Becerra and Mariona Ferrer.
112474.name: Inventum

112485.name: Neverball
112485.description:
Tilt the floor to roll a ball through an obstacle course before time runs out. Neverball is part puzzle game, part action game, and entirely a test of skill.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112486.name: 3-D Ultra Pinball
112486.description:
The original 3-D Ultra Pinball game was released in 1995. This game is based on the space simulation game, Outpost. There are three tables named Colony, Command Post, and Mine. Each table holds a set of five challenges. Smaller "mini-tables" are featured with their own set of flippers. The goal is to build and launch a Starship completing the game's entire course.

Source: Wikipedia, "3-D Ultra Pinball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine

Against All Oz

Cover art by Jeff Langcaon.

Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine

Party Like It's 1979

112490.name: Disney Pixar's Toy Story 3 (Leapster)
112490.description:
Use your word skills to rescue Woody, Buzz and their toy box pals when they discover their new home is not toy paradise!
• Teaches letters and word building, numbers and counting, addition and subtraction and coordinate mapping.
• Build words and look for bonus balloons to glide Woody to safety.
• Solve equations to help Woody avoid the night patrols as he escapes.
• Use coordinates to guide Buzz through the vending machine and grab bonus snacks.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Coloring Page and Printable Activity Sheet rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112491.name: Scooby-Doo! Math Times Two
112491.description:
Use math skills to outwit hungry monsters at four haunted hangouts , then head to the beach and carnival for more number fun!

• Teaches number recognition, addition, subtraction and sequencing.
• Jump on the seesaw to catch Scooby Snacks and complete multiplication challenges and more.
• Solve sequencing problems to feed hungry monsters the correct number of Scooby Snacks.
• Toss Scooby Snacks to the friend with the correct answer to addition or subtraction questions.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Coloring Page rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld™, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112492.name: Disney's The Princess and the Frog
112492.description:
Navigate number sequences in the bayou, count out ingredients for cooking and more to help Tiana pursue her dreams and find true love along the way!
• Teaches number and letter recognition, addition and subtraction, counting and phonics skills.
• Choose the correct amount of each ingredient to help Tiana make dinner.
• Explore addition and subtraction as Naveen hops to Tiana’s rescue.
• Choose the correct letter so Ray can lead the way to Mama Odie’s house.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Coloring Page and Recipe rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld™, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems

Source: The Publisher Website.

112493.name: Disney's Fairies
112493.description:
Journey through Pixie Hollow with Tinker Bell and friends using addition, subtraction, skip counting and more to collect lost things and rebuild toys for
children on the Mainland.
• Teaches shapes and patterns, addition and subtraction, more than/less than and logic and reasoning skills.
• Solve more than/less than problems as you paint beautiful butterfly wings with Fawn.
• Uncover Tinker Bell's hiding place in the flowers using logic and reasoning skills.
• Use your matching skills to help Tinker Bell rebuild toys.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Coloring Page and Printable Activity Sheet rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld™, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112494.name: Scholastic: My Amusement Park
112494.description:
Use your problem-solving skills to play games, build rides and create your own successful amusement park!
• Teaches problem-solving, logic and reasoning and memory skills.
• Show off your spelling, sorting and sequencing skills at the game booths.
• Put your personal touch on booths, rides or stands by coloring them the way you want.
• Save up enough money from your park to build your SUPER COASTER.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Coloring Page, Trading Card and Achievement Certificate rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112495.name: Leapster Kindergarten
112495.description:
Step right up to play fun-filled learning games that introduce kindergarten reading and math skills!
• Teaches letter sounds, word building, counting, addition and subtraction.
• Collect letters to make three-letter words as you climb ladders, bounce on trampolines and swing on vines.
• Use the correct number of tickets to buy parts at Mirabelle’s Monster Shop.
• Collect reward tickets every time you complete a game.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Achievement Certificate rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112496.name: Leapster 1st Grade
112496.description:
Play 6 action-packed learning games with Leap, Lily and Tad that introduce more than 70 first-grade reading and math skills!
• Teaches phonics skills, spelling, addition and subtraction and shapes.
• Match the word parts in the bubbles to create compound words.
• Solve the equations on the bumper cars, then guide them to the correct exit.
• Help a caterpillar become a beautiful butterfly by choosing the correct letters for it to eat.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Achievement Certificate rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112497.name: I Spy Challenger!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112497.description:
Box Description:

Are your fingers (and brain!) fast enough to beat the clock, advance to bonus rounds, and find all the hidden objects?

Riddle Round-Up:

Solve 36 I Spy riddles by hunting for hidden objects on the scrolling screen.

Hoop Drop:

Score bonus points by finding the correct hoops in time!

Grid Grab:

Race against the clock to find the matches and make it to the next level!

Match Attack:

Blast the objects before they close in-hit two or more at once to earn Free Matches.

Features:

-Over 100 levels of play

-Hundreds of brain-teasers

-Secret Riddle to unlock

-Unlimited bonus rounds

112498.name: Scholastic: Digging for Dinosaurs
112498.description:
Play games to learn fascinating facts about the Tyrannosaurus Rex, Stegosaurus and many other dinosaurs!
• Teaches science concepts, dinosaur facts and logic and reasoning skills.
• Learn how dinosaurs lived when they roamed the planet.
• Dig up dinosaur bones to see how each dinosaur was unique.
• Build skeletons for a Velociraptor, Triceratops and other dinosaurs to open a new exhibit in the museum.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Coloring Page, Trading Card and Achievement Certificate rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112499.name: The Penguins of Madagascar
112499.description:
Use your animal knowledge to help Skipper's Heroes shape up and take home the gold trophy in the Race for 1st Place!
• Teaches addition and subtraction, numbers and counting, letters and word building and animal facts.
• Listen to clues and unlock fun animal fact cards.
• Find the correct group of ninjas and bowl them over.
• Load Rico up with candies, then ready, aim, fire at letter and word challenges.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Coloring Page and Printable Activity Sheet rewards.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112500.name: Disney Pixar's Wall-E
112500.description:
Learn facts about recycling and the planets as you help WALL•E find his place in the universe!
• Teaches letter recognition, spelling skills and math skills.
• Plot a course to the Axiom and learn planetary facts along the way.
• Solve math problems to reveal constellations.
• Blast the robots with the correct answers to spelling questions and help EVE bring WALL•E home.
• Parents can follow their child’s play and learning progress on the LeapFrog® Learning Path.
• Connect the handheld to your computer to access earned Printable Activity Sheet and High Score rewards.
• Play in LeapWorld™, a safe, online learning world with more games and rewards to expand the fun.
• Works only with Leapster and Leapster2 learning game systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.
